text:
This place is phenomenal. I had my first visit around Halloween and have been back weekly ever since. I'm a huge fan of Kim Chee and these folks have nailed it. The coffees and teas they have next door are extremely good as well. I usually will take some back to the office after lunch. 

Living in NYC, I used to love to hit St Mark's and enjoy some good ramen. I figured I had lost that opportunity upon moving here, but thanks to Republic, I"m back in business. Keep up the good food, I'll see you guys next week!

Tried the spicy ramen with egg and beef.  I lived in Tokyo and I have tried many different types of ramen.  I didn't have high expectations but I thought it was good.  I will definitely go there again.

I was in line to order when I heard the counter person insulting a customer. 
 I never had seen such poor customer service in my life and rude people yelling and eating,
 I will not be back I bet ramen in the package is just as good.

I'm going to keep this short and sweet. I ordered miso ramen and they gave me shoyu. I immediately knew that it wasn't miso because it lacked miso's distinct foggy hue and traces of fermented bean paste.  I have grown accustomed to the unique look of miso broth after having lived in Chiba/Tokyo for 3 years.

When I took my bowl to the service counter, the attending chef told me that because their miso has no MSG, it isn't as potent as "regular" miso. I have had MANY types of miso, and none of them taste like bland greasy salt water. Rather than own up to his mistake, the chef lied to my face. To make the situation worse, as I left the restaurant I saw a fellow customer enjoying genuine miso broth ramen.
This place is hands down the best place I have been to in AZ for ramen. I used to go to Hawaii quite a bit and I loved the Ramen Houses there. I will definitely be back!

The customer service was terrible. When ordering, I told the cashier that this was my first time here and I knew of the restaurant from a flyer I read at work. I proceeded to ask the cashier what he would recommend. The cashier spoke in an extremely quiet voice , could barely hear him and he could not answer my question. As this was going on, I had noticed dirty tables all over the restaurant. Dirty dishes everywhere. I still continued with my order because the menu looked so delicious and I had planned on eating there for lunch and the place was busy. I ate outside because of all the empty dirty tables. It took 15 minutes , maybe a lil longer to be served my order. I wasn't even served , I actually had to go back to cashier and ask for my order. Honestly, the food was not worth all the poor customer service. I gave the restaurant a chance and I feel it was a waste of my time and money. I will never go back.

Where to start...

I used to like this place a lot and I came here often. Not sure if they changed management, but the place no longer has coupons anywhere so it's extremely overpriced. Don't be fooled by the $2 gyoza dumplings; they're the size of a quarter and there's only 3. Also, if the girl asks you if you want garlic, say no because she doesn't tell you that it's 50 cents extra and you'll never taste the difference. 

The flavor of the broth is good, decent portion sizes. It's better to order without meat, because I've tried all their meats and they're all pretty terrible, dry, and tough. Their chicken is actually kind of gross. Even though ramen is supposed to have a lot of toppings, only order toppings if you want to spend over 10 dollars for a bowl of noodles because each one is about $1, and they're not very good and in small portions.

Their tempura is pretty good and the best deal on the menu is the udon with tempura. Their boba is pretty good for Arizona.

However, I have some issues with their customer service, the last two times I've been they've over charged me by adding things like eggs that I didn't want and then would not take it off my charge. Their staff is pretty rude in general, so I probably won't go back because I seriously value an overall experience.

A little disappointing because it is in a great location and there aren't many ramen places around.

In reality more like a 3.5 stars. I've been by this place many times and I was finally able to give it a go. Rather than ramble on about ambiance, the service, the location I'll cut right to what matters: the food. I'm a vegetarian and as such I accept that my dining options are not as vast as those with unrestricted diets. However, Asian cuisine is generally very veg friendly and as such I dine at Asian restaurants probably more than any other type of restaurant. Unfortunately, Republic Ramen falls a touch short of what I'd call "Veg Friendly". The only option you'll have is the Vegetarian Ramen, which is OK because that is what I came in there for. And while the ramen was good (very rich, salty and tons of toppings) one dining option is not enough to make me a regular. It would be nice to try, say some udon noodles or an appetizer that isn't edamame.

Again, the ramen is good. And the price is fair. But would it really be so bad to leave the fish sauce out of a dish or two? Or to try using a vegetarian dashi instead of a fish-based dashi?

I don't normally eat Japanese food so I can't compare, but I thought it was pretty good! At first I thought 10 bucks for a bowl of some ramen noodles was crazy but when I saw how big the damn bowl was, I was satisfied. They have a lot of different bowls to choose from as well as toppings to add which definitly gives me a reason to come back.
The ramen isn't amazing by any means, but it's pretty decent. Good fix to satisfy your ramen cravings!

A solid three stars, I think! No, it's NOT the authentic Hakata-style ramen I crave but it's not the 25cent kind either! The noodles are REALLY well done and the broths (tonkatsu, spicy tonkatsu and the shoyu) were very tasty and full of flavor. The toppings in the traditional style leave a lot to be desired and the pork is NOT chashu-style.

The boba drinks are nice and the service was pretty good. Overall, I'd give them another try.
Average ramen but is already enough for a near school ramen restaurant. The spicy oil and power are very good. I prefer the traditional style

Excellent food and service. I always order ahead and go pick up the food so I can take it back to a quiet spot and watch tv during lunchtime, and they always have my order ready when I get there.

One thing you should know: the portions are HHHUUUUUUGGGGGEEE. You probably won't be able to finish all of it. So when you're choosing add-ons like eggs (I like their eggs!), keep in mind that the bowl is already ginormous.
My least favorite ramen place. I'm just spoiled by really good ramen in my home town of Portland.

Visited a boy at ASU, and he recommended this place. I wasn't disappointing, this place was awesome! I tried the Vegetarian Ramen, and it was meatless, and wonderful. Much like me after my cleanse. 

I would totally go there again.. I guess it depends on if I see this boy again. :)
This place used to be good, but they seem to have fallen off. I will not be going back. The bathroom and kitchen looked like they haven't been cleaned in weeks. This place needs to be inspected.

This place is fantastic.  The Tonkastu ramen is our favorite.  It is very tasty.  After leaving San Francisco, we missed having ramen.  We were very happy when we found this place.  The decor is very nice.  The staff is awesome - somehow they hire some of the nicest and helpful people out there.  The snow boba is great too.

ehhhhhh, i was really excited to have a ramen shop next to my house.. but honeslty i can't tell difference between their ramen and the frozen one. 
Broth is so-so, and noodles... i think they use frozen.
Their gyoza is not really worth it, neither is their fried rice. 

I guess its okay, if your craving a quick grab, but kind of expensive for not good quality ramen. 
Dose not taste ANYTHING like real ramen in Japan. 

Their boba is pretty good though =D and staff is very friendly.

Super nice people and great customer service, but the food is not good at all.  Don't go there if you've ever had real Ramen before.  I had Miso Ramen, and the broth tasted like ginger soup with a hint of Miso.  Noddles were not Ramen noodles and overcooked, the boiled egg was an additional $1and overcooked, and had no flavor.  They use very low quality meat for Chashu, too.  Being from Japan, I'm not sure if I would call this noodle dish Ramen.  Like other reviewers mentioned, the instant Ramen from Asian markets taste better than this.

Visited recently with my son - an avowed ramen fan - both of us had the tonkatsu ramen. It was fantastic!  Rich, tasty broth, fresh vegetables, and the noodles were firm and delicious. The decor here is Spartan and clean, with lots of natural light from the windows.  All in all very inviting and friendly. The person who took our order was friendly and very helpful, explaining the menu and suggesting drinks. He even suggested getting a combo milk tea - almond and honeydew - a very refreshing combination. A wonderful place - head down and gives these folks business, it's definitely a restaurant worth keeping.

Let me just start by saying this place is really affordable, but unfortunately you really get what you pay for. The noodles are okay but all of the food including the udon and ramen are way too salty. The decor makes a nice attempt at being a hip modern spot but their fans are covered in dust and the seating is extremely uncomfortable. I was stoked when I saw the prices, but overall my experience was not great. I wouldn't return for the food or the ambiance.
Great taste. The ramen are all good. Shrimp tempura and squid salad are especially delicious.
The worst ramen I tried. The udon and tempura are horrible. Soooo salty!!! And the service is horrible. Will never go here again!

Love love love this place.  It is fresh, clean, and affordable.  The portions are so a friend and I can share an entree (we always get the Tonkatsu and spice it up with the Sriracha sauce) and the service is always great or exceptional.  Boba is always tasty, and I hear the special summer menu is coming...can't wait!

On the East side of ASU's sprawling csmpus, Republic Ramen + Noodles is the perfect spot to cure your Mill Ave. hang over. Or stop by any time for a taste of authentic ramen bowls.

Definitely a favorite of mine to bring out of towners to. They think they are headed to an authentic taco shack and end up in a trendy little ramen spot.

I fucking love this place!!!!!!!! I went there 2 times in the same week because the first time was my first time ever being there and I'm so addicted now. they have spam! and i love eggs. I'm Vietnamese so i love Vietnamese food but this place is one of my favorite noodle places now, it's so bomb, sometimes I'm just hanging out and I get the taste in my mouth for it, I would go there again to make it 3 times this week. 

and yeah some people are complaining and saying "well I've been here and here and they have way better ramen...." but guess what? this is AZ and we only have so much here, it's not LA so you can't compare it. I don't travel as much as i like so when i find a good restaurant here i know how to appreciate it.

This is a very unique restaurant for the Phoenix area. Not many other restaurants doing this style of food in town. I've been here a couple times and enjoyed myself each time bringing different friends to try it out.  Highly recommended and will go there as often as I can.
Eh. The food is kind of bland and the staff wasn't very attentive. The only good thing there is boba tea which is probably the only reason I'll go back.

Pretty good and inexpensive, especially if you're willing to share a bowl (they're more than big enough for two people).

The chicken gets VERY overcooked because of the heat of the soup. I'd suggest a different meat. I also love to add corn and an egg.

This place is AWESOME!  I could there everyday no problem.  It's super inexpensive and they bring you a huge bowl, enough to feed 2, but you'll find that you continually keep eating no matter how full you are because it's so good.  The ramen has so much flavor and it's delicious with all the fresh veggies.  AND they offer Boba tea which is another bonus.  Check this place out if you're looking for something tasty and cheap.

Ill have to admit then place of alright.  The portions are pretty Big but I felt the noodles was a  bit over cooked.  The broth tasted decent but not very impressed.  I had the Tokyo ramen traditional style with no egg in it which I found a bit different.   Tampopo ramen is more of a traditional Japanese ramen in my opinion.

Their ramen wasn't authentic at all, but it did at least satisfy my ramen craving.  It seems strange to have raw spinach in the ramen....and the vegetables they put in aren't cooked at all so they're too hard and crispy and takes away from the flavor of the actual ramen.  Their boba drinks here are awesome and I'd come here just to get that if I was craving boba.  While I wish their ramen was better, I'd probably still come back here again if I was craving Ramen since it is so close to campus.

I haven't actually eaten my food here or eaten all of the dishes, but the ramen I have had here is extremely fucking tasty. The one problem I have is that there char siu is pretty thin. I've had ramen in a lot of countries and the standard for Japanese ramen is to cut the pork pretty thick (and throw an egg on top for bonus points). Granted I've only eaten here once but the pork was pretty thin....and I didnt hear anything about an egg. But i"m not ging to hold that against them. They have a great location, a clean shop, and a tasty menu. Will definitely be back as soon as I can convince my work lunch buddy to take me there :)

Absolutely delicious!  The price is great for the amount of food.  I find myself coming back over and over - the boba is great, also.  The ambience is really nice, too, and the noodles are fresh and the broth is delicious!  Best ramen in the area, by far.  They have two different options for the toppings, which is really nice for your preference.  Love this place!

DISSAPPOINTED!!
I ordered the TONKOTSU ramen with chyashu pork of course, but they ran out of pork!!! So I supplemented with egg and chicken. 
Soup was thin and flavorless, egg over cooked, chicken bland, the bean sprouts, and spinach was not helpful or wanted!
I make better instant ramen at home! Having had unforgettable ramen from Japan and very good ramen in Hawaii and irresistable ramen in Vegas even.... I'm sad AZ ramen is embarrassing.

I'm not super into ramen, but I've been eyeballing this place for months every time I pass it. Today, it was time to finally give it a try.

I got the republic ramen with pork. The menu says that every ramen dish comes with spinach, sprouts, scallions and carrots. My order came with most of this, except the carrots. Instead, I got carrot. 1 tiny piece of a carrot. Haha.. that's a bit of a shame considering I love carrots. I wasn't expecting  a lot, but it was literally just a tiny nickel-sized piece of carrot. The broth was not terribly flavorful. The portion size was generous enough that I can get two meals out of it, which is nice for the price.

I also got the veggie tempura side, which is usually 3 dollars, but was only 2 because I came during happy hour. It was pretty good- highlight of my lunch/dinner.

The boba I got was definitely the best part. It might not be the greatest boba ever, but I'm not exactly a connoisseur so it seemed pretty damn good to me. I got the Thai milk tea, and it was super delicious with a generous portion of boba. Very refreshing on a hot summer day.

The staff was very friendly.

All in all.. I think I might try some other dishes here, but I probably won't come back for the ramen. Will definitely return for tea.

I came in to Ramen Republic just past 8pm the other day to order a boba drink. I have been there before and find their ramen okaaay, but on Tuesday I only wanted to grab a drink on my way home. I quickly looked up their restaurant hours and when I saw that they closed at 9pm I knew I had more than enough time. After all, it was only 8:10 or so. 

When I walked in and approached the boba menu (which is off to the side a bit), the girl at the counter said nothing to me. Not even a greeting. After making a mental selection on which flavor I wanted to get, I got in line behind a group of four friends, who I assumed were about to order since they were all standing in front of the register. I was standing for quite a few minutes minding my own business before I finally realized they weren't ordering at all! They were all chatting with the cashier who was loudly complaining to them about how customers will often stay in the restaurant past close, and how it drives her crazy because she has much more important things to do and thats she's in medical school and blah blah blah. The girl was literally ranting. At this point there is at least one other costumer who has gotten in line behind me, and two additional girls walk in and approach the boba menu. She calls over to them "The boba machine is closed." and when they asked why she said in a matter-of-fact tone, "It closes an hour before the kitchen." turns her head back to the group of guys talking to her and rolls her eyes. Why couldn't she have mentioned that to me when I walked in?! She HAD to have seen me leaning over to read the boba menu? I left, highly agitated that I wasted so much time waiting in "line" to order a drink she would have refused to prepare anyway. When a restaurant posts it's hours, I have to assume all menu items will be available unless otherwise specified, and the rule about the boba machine is not stated anywhere online or in store. In fact, I think the girl working was just lying so she didn't have to stay late to clean the machine. Either way, I was so off-put by the service that I will not be returning.

Like similar reviewers, I'm rating this restaurant semi-highly because of their fun drink selection (including boba and chu-hi's), and not necessarily because of the ramen.

Flat out, ANY Japanese-style restaurant that sells chu-hi gets my nod of approval. I absolutely love that cheap, wine-cooler like liquor and it's so, so difficult to find in the states. The boba here is really nice as well. The guy working the counter the first time I had boba was even considerate enough to ask me how sweet I wanted it!

I had the vegetarian ramen and gyoza when I ate here. I am very particular about ramen, and for me the broth wasn't complex or flavorful enough. I am planning to go back and try the tonkatsu ramen as a final verdict, so we'll see. Plus the gyoza was deep fried, and I was hoping it would have been prepared more authentic-style--steamed on the top and crispy only on the bottom.

Overall, this place is a nice homage to authentic Japanese ramen shops (even in decor), but not quite the real deal.

I found Republic Ramen after a spring training game in Mesa.  I was starving, saw their sign, and decided to pop in.  

I'm not really a ramen connoisseur, have only eaten it a few times.  But I did like this place, enough to come back again on my way back home. Friendly service, tasty food, very generous portions, and bright, clean location.  The server and cook made it a point to verify my order a couple times (they basically wanted to ensure I wasn't expecting a vegan serving), which I thought was good service. I'll drop in again next time I'm in Tempe.

So surprised by this place. I should of known everything would be great by the sheer fact that they have boba. AAhhhh, I looooovveeee boba. Outside of boba, the soup was great! The biggest serving I've ever had in regards to soup. I ordered the miso soup with tofu because I wasn't feeling too adventurous flavor wise. The soup is mostly broth in comparison to veggies, noodles, and protein selection (but keep in mind the size of the bowl). Seaweed salad was put together in a way I've never seen before. It was very artistic. Usually I've only ever seen it just as the seaweed alone. Very cool. I appreciated that they served forks for those of us who are chop stick challenged when it comes to soup and noodles. Will be back!

Absoluetly love it here! I came by three times this week and the taste was the same. The spicy ramen was not too spicy and had awesome flavor. Some of the workers are really kind and attentive. The chicken curry was really good too! Have yet to try the Boba, but will do the next time i stop in.
It was good. There were a variety of options to choose from. In a great location and easy to find. Wasn't blown away, though.

Only ate here once; got the lightest ramen (chicken base?) with chicken cubes.  So tasty!  OK, so the noodles aren't homemade (hence the lack of 5th star) but was impressed with the takeout packaging.  The broth was kept separate from the noodles/veg/meat so I could combine them at home.  Huge portion, had enough for leftovers the next day.  The Bobo wasn't sweet enough for my liking, but I can ask for sugar next time.  I was also glad to find another Bobo joint.  I'm so going to be back!
Good, casual Ramen restaurant.  Takes a while for you to get your order.  Inside can feel crowded.

After hearing my friends talk about this place all the time I finally decided to give it a try a couple night ago, bad idea because it was pretty crowded! I checked the menu online and was unsure if I would even like it (Only ever had .10 ramen) I don't ever leave reviews but I was slightly surprised this place didn't have more positive feedback. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen which the cashier recommended it was pretty good  but the noodles were slightly overlooked. Loved the portions size tho! I do think they should put less broth, the noodle to broth ratio is off. Like the other reviewer wrote, I too thought it was weird there was a tip option for the workers BUT while waiting for my food I realized just how much the cashier does! They were all over the place doing so many things it was hard to even get a container for the rest of my ramen. I probably noticed all this since I've mostly worked in restaurants most my life and know how hectic it can be. Anyways, pretty good ramen! Will definitely be back again.
I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, which was quite good.  The noodles were cooked perfectly!  Very tasty food, although a tad overpriced.

Ramen is lacking in the Phoenix area.  However, if you have a craving for ramen, Republic Ramen will satisfy you.  You have the standard tonkotsu (pork marrow), miso, and shoyu (soy sauce) broths with some nice variants of these standards.  They're all tasty and you have a nice variety of traditional and not so traditional add-ins.  I found the restaurant to have a nice, "good enough" decor, though they lose a star due to the dirty bathrooms.  The management really needs to implement a more regular bathroom cleaning schedule.

Price is decent, though expect to add on top of the base price.

Quick Note:
If you are looking for a upscale "instant noodle", then this is the place. I should add the ramen served is not really instant noodle, but closely resembles one. If you are looking for a true ramen place, this is not it and if you are a purist-who-complains-a-LOT, stay away! I recommend it to most otherwise.

The Food:
Fortunately, the range of additional toppings is pretty good, but every little bit adds up. The total for my order of Spicy Ramen +Egg +Chashu +Vege Paste +Garlic Paste +Chili Paste and a regular drink adds up to $17.27!!!

The soup is what resembles instant noodle the most. It taste like plenty of MSG in it, but is so delicious, I finished it anyways. 

The Place:
The place looks even more spacious due to it's open design. Definitely a hipster vs foodie place. There is a bar/restaurant combo on one side and a regular restaurant on the other side.

Da Service:
This place is pretty much self-service except when they bring the food to you. You order it at the counter. They give you a placard on a holder with a number for delivery to table. Condiments and utensils are near the soda machine.

Ultimately: 
Not too bad. Not excellent. A good place for students, which seems like the bulk of their customers anyways. Unless you are overly critical over ramen, add this place to the list of backup restaurants especially on a cold day (but this is AZland!).

I live about 20 miles from this place but I would walk there if I had to, that's how much I love their ramen. I usually get the Chili Pepper Ramen with traditional toppings and beef, too good for words!

So delicious! The service was awesome & super friendly to a couple of 1st timers. The guy who took our order took the time to explain the menu & how to order. Our food came out fast & hot. I ordered the Republic style & only wish that the broth had a little more beef flavor to it. Nonetheless, I was very pleased. We also had the gyoza, which came out crispy & very yummy. They were a pretty good deal-$2 for 3 dumplings. The portions are large-I finished about 75% of my bowl & left full, happy & very satisfied. I will definitely be returning.

One of my favorite restaurants in Tempe.  I have tried a couple of the ramens, but the Republic and chili pepper are my go-to favorites.  I usually order the ramen with traditional toppings, but both selections of toppings are great.  I also enjoy the good selection of bobas.  The prices are also pretty reasonable and if you are looking for ramen this is the place to try.

Absolutely love this place! I've been coming here for over 4 years now. The staff is wonderful and helpful and I love seeing them when I come in. They also remember me and my boyfriend which is amazing! The food is also great here, I've had the edamame, multiple ramen bowls, and multiple flavors of their boba teas. 
My all around favorite: pork tankatsu ramen and Thai milk tea boba. 
I probably order this combination the most out of anything else here and I love it!

The first time I went, they were horribly understaffed. No spoons, dirty tables all over the place, took at least 10+ minutes for the order, the experience was a mess. If I hadn't come back, it'd be a one-star easy.

Gave it another shot as it was the only place open at the time. Tried the miso ramen this time, but if it wasn't for the miso floating in the soup, I'd think it was normal shoyu broth. They did try to be creative with different veggies, but the baby spinach is not a great idea as it broke down quickly in the hot broth, which was still hot after a while, so a plus there. Maybe I've been spoiled by other ramen shops on the west coast, but I find this place forgettable. Well, the only thing I won't forget is not wanting to come back.

After getting a massage (and propositioned by two naked Asian "massage therapists")

(Oh no I din't!!!)

~just massage my feet please~

I headed over here to try the veggie Ramen, and I have to say it was very tasty.

Almost as tasty as the intoxicating blonde who took my order.

Too bad she wasn't on the dessert menu.

All in all, a happy ending for sure.

Ramen isn't like that foamy starch they serve in Styrofoam cups you get from the truck stop.  Ramen is a rich, thick broth with hearty noodles, delicious meat (or tofu), and some exotic add-ons to pull the whole experience together.  If you're a ramen fan, or just want to try something new and delicious in Tempe, visit Republic Ramen + Noodles.

This place serves dome fabulous ramen.  They also have a cafe that serves delicious milk tea.

I get the rice noodles in my ramen so I don't have to worry about glutein. I love the food. I have been here by myself to just sit down and eat and it doesn't feel weird  at all. I like to just pick up some yummies and go. There is enough in one ramen bowl for 2 or 3 meals. They also have beer and saki and edmame and my personal favorite gyoza. This is a great place for lunch or dinner.
I'd been eating here for over a year, but recently something has changed.  I still like it, but it isn't the meal that has drawn me to eat there as often as I had been before.

An alright little place. Lots of college students and university staff can be found here (ASU). The staff are above average and have never been an issue seeing as they really just take your order at the register and then bring your food out, so there isnt really much to mess up. Its the food. If you cant eat pork, prepare to be disappointed, they have 1 dish, literally 1 dish that ISNT made with pork broth. Its really disheartening, but I didnt dock points for that because whatever im just one person and thats my specific need. I did however dock points because even with the 1 dish that I had, it was extremely...bland. Now the only things with flavor were the added ingredients, but even then I felt like the egg had just the flavor beat out of it along with anything else in the bowl. Its not horrible exactly but it definitely leaves something to be desired. I constantly order the 2/4 piece shrimp tempura and the edamame sides and BOTH of them TASTE LIKE THE RAMEN, in that they dont really taste like much at all! 

I mean fuckin' hell how do you remove flavor from shrimp? Why does edamame taste like literally nothing? This place is really a mystery to me. I go there sometimes when I happen to be driving by, but lets just say that I never leave my house with the intent of going to Republic Ramen.
Who doesn't like ramen? Their menu is build-your-own style and every choice is delicious.

I'm happy to see that something worthwhile has replaced the dismal hole that was Sparky's.  The atmosphere is light and calm, the service is friendly, and the staff seems to enjoy what they do.  When I went, they said they were still perfecting their recipes, which means it should only get even better.

You order at the counter, grab a table, and they bring your food when it's ready.  Soda is self-serve.  I had ramen and spam, and it was my first time with spam.  It was good for what it was, but just not to my taste.  The rest of the soup was pretty good though.  The squid salad ($6 for a decent amount of it) was very good and the squid didn't have that weird rubbery texture it gets when it isn't quite fresh.  I got a mango-almond snow boba and it was amaaziing.  Seriously, try this.  The guy who made it even tried some and was impressed.

Definitely will go back here.  Maybe even later today because it's sounding pretty good right now.
Udon noodle itself is good but the soup is like way too salty!  Salty and terrible salty!

My stop here was at the request of my Son. Geeze the bowl I had was very bland and warm at best. The chicken was very tough and it tasted like they just threw it all together with tap water. I see why it might be popular for the students...inexpensive for the amount of food. But guys, there was no taste to it. My Sons also was bland. Now wonder there is so much Sriracha & dry spices around. But, it all needs to be cooked together in my opinion for flavor.
I stop by and finaly  try this ramen soup, is amazing :) my friend tell me about but never had time to come here and have this soup. I will come back for sure :)

I needed to write my first review because this place had a 3.5 star rating and I think it's unfair. This is only after my first visit here and it was by chance because Unami was closed.

My first encounter with ramen outside of a cup of noodles was in san francisco at Ajisen Ramen, that place spoiled me and helped me set a standard. Ever since then Ive had ramen regularly in san diego and las vegas and once in New York, all good, however only two are worthy #2s after Ajisen's Tonkotsu ramen and they are Tajima in San Diego and Republic Ramen in Tempe.

I ordered a Tonkotsu broth with pork and traditional topings, although they got my toppings wrong and gave me original Republic Ramen toppings which were scallions, spinach and carrots, but you know what? It was still reaaaally good. I asked for a medium spice to the broth and it made my nose a lil' runny, which I love ... perfect spice, and also a soy sauce cured egg, which I was hoping was soft boiled but was hard boiled, again, it didnt detract from the experience.

In conclusion this place is legit and has above standard ramen, unlike Cherry Blossom Cafe or Culinary Drop Out and Clever Koi which are all wanna bes compared to Republic Ramen. This place is Legit! I will be driving from Metro PHX to Tempe at least twice a month to this place.

Excellent food and serving sizes

Always hot and fresh

Never had a bad experience to date.

Love adding corn and egg to my bowl along with a pina colada boba slush!

This 5 star rating is mostly for their boba! They are cool about how many flavors I put into my boba (usually about 4!) unlike other boba shops that only allow like 2

Their ramen is pretty good and decently priced. However, I don't like coming to this place much ONLY because I don't like coming out smelling like an Asian restaurant.

Place was clean and had a modern look. Ordered the tonkatsu ramen with pork.  The ramen came in a large bowl with all the fixins (bean sprouts, green onions, carrots, and spinach) which I really did not care for. The broth was flavorful, the pork was tasty and plentiful, and the noodles were very good. Overall, very satisfied as I was craving ramen.  I would definitely come back.

I give it four stars just cause I can't find any other place in the valley that specializes in ramen. I think it's worth the money, I'm usually filled to the brim by the time I'm done eating. Most ramen can be customized, you can choose what meat to add, you can also add fishcake, eggs, and extra vegetables. The basic ramen is loaded with vegetables anyway, so you don't have to drink a V8 later. 

The atmosphere is a little awkward though, the usual music being played is pretty obnoxious. Otherwise a fine establishment, nice staff, clean floors, tables, utensils, etc.
Stumbled upon this place as my first ramen experience. Super good ramen and good prices. Large amounts, the kimchi is only $1 and you get a huge portion. Been back four times in one month.

Well, it was a nice experience, the server was nice, and it was pricy, but considering its the only ramen place around i can deal with it. I doubt its anything like ramen in japan, but again, it's the only choice. I'll be going back. If anything just for the boba, which was refreshing and tasty. :)

Their boba with coffee is great... we had the tonkotsu ramen and the republic ramen... the actual ramen noodles were pretty good and the broth was tasty. I can't say is the best I've had... but not bad...the pork and the beef not very good with an old taste..  size was good and the place nice and clean as well. Cashier was a little clumsy  when food was delivered to the table... spilling broth on the tray and table... overall an ok experience...

I'm from Los Angeles, and I've had some incredible ramen in that area, and was really sad that there aren't really any ramen places around the Phoenix area.  When I first learned that there was a ramen place opening up, I thought to myself that there was the potential for a great experience.

The idea of this place is nice, but the execution is lacking.  I ordered the Republic Ramen + Gyoza combo, with the extremely spicy option, no additions, I wanted to try their base specialty.

The gyoza was alright, it was a little too greasy when I got it, but I much prefer fried gyoza to steamed, so that was a plus.  Unfortunately, this gyoza was mixed, meat and veggies, and I wasn't prepared for that.  Generally, I prefer pork gyoza, although I know some people who prefer veggie gyoza.  The combination didn't work too well because there wasn't quite enough meat, and the veggies were a little too rubbery for my taste.

Individually, components were good, I could tell the vegetables were fresh; the green onion had the taste of raw green onion, the bean sprouts were crisp, the spinach hadn't the time to wilt. and the naruto slice tasted of fish, and not of bland texture.

What I found lacking, however, was that the broth was overly salty and lacking it's own depth of flavor, it was also not hot enough, and the pork was very overcooked - I'm not just saying that, either, the pork was brown.  As a matter of taste, I would have preferred they use japanese spinach or nori in the ramen, and for the broth to have been piping hot, still bubbling even.

All in all, it was nothing spectacular, with lots of room to improve.  For the price, though, it was a decent meal.

Went in on a Monday night and waited in a 15 minute line. Sat down and got our food at separate times and after we finished our meals, had to wait at the front for my boba tea I ordered for 15 more minutes. Umami down the road is better.
This is our favorite ramen restaurant and for good reason. The food is great and the staff is fantastic!

HEY YALL....boy oh boy am I glad against my best judgement of not feeling well am i glad that I left this hotel to come to this place Republic Ramen Noodles SWEET BABY JESUS...I ordered Tonkotsu Ramen added sweet corn and an order of tempura shrimp. I was very very tastee...The pork I added was not memorable,  but that was my focus either my main concern was the noodles( plentiful) and broth( hot & yummy )....When I go back later this week I will be ordering this again, but without meat nothing personal but when are we going up we ate Ramen all the time without meat it was just a bonus. Oh yea I had them to removed the bean sprouts and next time NO SPINACH. This is a must try anytime you come to Tempe, Arizona.
Great ramen. Spent a year in Japan and this reminded me of being there. Will be going back.

I found a good Raman place here in the Phoenix area. I'm from LA so Republic Ramen doesn't compare but hey it's great to  find a location in Phoenix. 

I ordered a Tonkotsu Ramen, traditional toppings with the addition of egg & zucchini. It was very yummy. Noodles were perfectly cooked and the broth & vegetables all work together.

For those looking for good Ramen this place hits the mark. I recommend Republic Ramen!

First time here when in with big expectations was greatly disappointed. The service was bad had to wait more than 30 minutes for my food for takeout. They gave me a lame excuse something about a printer. You would think that the front cashiers would see no food going out and would of caught the problem right away instead of waiting around for 20 or 30 minutes. Finally got back to my room with my ordered (Tokyo ramen noodles and the shrimp tempura) It was only a two minute walk and the shrimp tempura was cold and Soggy and the soup was not what I expected. I've had better ramen noodles from a grocery store do-it-yourself pack. Maybe the only good thing was the fresh veggies that came with it

The ramen noodles here are filling and tasty. I got a to go order and was happy with the packaging of the soup. They put the broth separate from the noodles and toppings that way it doesn't get soggy and you still get the same amount as you would eating in the restaurant. There's also a cool bobba tea spot connected to the building that I'm excited to try.

The service was good as the staff was friendly and accommodating and the wait for the food wasn't bad.

The price was decent as well. You get a lot of food for about $10. Overall, good noodles for a good price.

This place is yummy! The udon broth is tasty and the prices are very reasonable. It's also close to campus, which is a huge plus for me because it's convenient to stop by for a meal anytime. The only downside is the horribly long lines during peak hours, when the queue goes out the door. The boba is decent, they didn't put very much boba into the cup, but it was delicious nonetheless. Highly recommend if you're craving good ramen or udon!
This is by far the best ramen place I have ever been too.. I always get the republic ramen with tofu and chicken it's so amazing! The only place I eat ramen at.
Great food for the value.  Prices are excellent and a solid choice of Vegetarian dishes.   Hot and iced tea choices pushed this from 4 to 5 stars

I would take Republic Ramen for what it is- fast food ramen priced inexpensively, located in the heart of a college town. 

There is, unfortunately, a huge dearth of good ramen places here in Phoenix. When my girlfriend told me about this, I was keen on checking it out. I love Cherry Blossom, but it gets a bit boring to have that be the only joint in town I enjoy ramen at! Also, nothing helps clear blocked allergies like hot ramen and a steaming cup of green tea! 

I got the tonkatsu ramen, whilst the boyfriend got the miso ramen. I had no complaints about mine. It wasn't rocking my proverbial world, but it was good decent food. It tasted like tonkatsu broth, and I liked the fresh spinach, bean sprouts and the egg I paid extra for. 

His miso ramen, however, was very disappointing. A friend had warned me that this was 'white people ramen', and his ramen lived up to that warning. It tasted like bland, straight up soy sauce broth. No trace of miso at all. I actually forgot he had miso stock and not the soy sauce before he reminded me about it. 

The gyoza were also nicely edible, but nothing to go home talking about. 

As I said, take it for what it is. Fast food ramen in a college town. It's good to satisfy your cravings, but not something that will rock your world. Not everything can be 5 stars. My suspicion is that you'll find just such mediocre ramen places even in Japan.

Dear Republic Ramen, I wanted to like you so much.

Your decent prices and over-the-counter breezy service were the reason why I walked in today. But there's one thing that's made me feel compelled to write this review. Here it goes. 

I simply cannot tolerate the blatant cheating using MSG to create your broth. That Ichiban Instant Ramen flavor was instantly recognizable the second I tasted your "Tonkotsu" broth. Where's the thickness, richness, the layers of flavor, the fat floating on top? Not to mention 3 hours later, that MSG extreme thirsty feeling hits me and I know clearly who's the culprit. 

Republic Ramen, it's been good knowing you but I'm afraid we won't see each other again. Sayonara.
Only true ramen joint in this cultureless barren wasteland known as Phoenix metropolitan area.  Enjoy it while you can, places like this doesn't have long life expectancy.

You cant go wrong with the Ramen... It's as good as any I've had in Tokyo, NY or SF...  The Miso is great and all the fresh ingredients blend deliciously. I also like the gyoza and shrimp tempura as well. It adds up quick, but if you go there hungry you wont be disappointed...
Republic Ramen is amazing! I love all the broth flavors, and the variety of add-ins. And their cafe is great too! Excellent boba, and coffee as well
The broth is bland, and the noodles were too soggy--worse than the ones in Top Ramen. Step up your game!

I am not going to share my giant noodle soup bowl with anyone.
Nor am I going to share my Boba with anyone.  
 
Soup:  nice presentation, not too salty.  Not too hot, nor cold;  just right to dig in right away.  Pick your broth;  I'm a salt o holic, and even then, I added more salt and spice to my broth, so sue me and pass me the hypertensive pill.
 
Gyoza:  could eat more;  please give more.  
 
Boba pearls:  nice chewy consistency;  not overdone or underdone.  No aspiration pnemonia here;  could be a bit colder in temp, but that's probably because I waited to drink it after I ate the bowl of ramen.  
 
Beggars can't be choosers;  the Ramen here is decent.  It's better than the 49 cent kind (inflation you know) and far worse than the noodle houses in Japan--what do you expect, it's the DESERT for heaven's sake.  
 
For college kids:  what a great intro to far east staple food.
Delicious ramen with a nice variety of options. Great option for eating there or taking it to go.

This place has great food, no doubting that. The service, though, is just atrociou. The proportions were really unevenly distributed. My date and I ordered the same exact meal and mine had at least 3x the amount of noodles she had. Also I ordered a snow tarot boba when I first came in, they delivered it half way through the meal. It ended up being the wrong type of boba, so I told them , and it wasn't delivered for 30 more minutes. my date even overheard the workers talking badly about me for asking about my rightful order. This place could be so great if it weren't this horrendous service.

I'm sorry but this place is by far the worse place I ever dined. Watching  the cooks playing with there coffee drink while I ordered makes me uncomfortable also watching them slap the the waitress on the ass while I was trying to order was unacceptable and the taste of the food proved to horrible!

First and formost I will have you know I am an avid pho eater and Boba drinker. Coming from the Los Angeles area, I know what is good and what is not. This place is AWESOME! Service is fantastic. There is a server there named Tony who is extremely personable and makes delicious drinks-ask for him. The music is good and there is a nice vibe. The Shoyu is definitely my favorite bowl as well as the Thai Milk Tea! The boba is always soft. The restaurant is extremely clean and the workers take pride in their services there. They also have a wide variety of alcoholic beverages. This place is GREAT, I recommend it to all of my close friends. Also very reasonable prices.

Today is cool and rainy.  Perfect day for Ramen & noodles.  Wife ordered Tonkotsu and I had Republic ramen. We both had pork for the meat extra corn and an egg. The Tonkotsu clean mild promontory. The Republic had complex flavor mild spicy I added Saatchi . Both the noodles were good.  We both really enjoyed the food.  Really hit the spot on a day like today.  We will return.  Food taste great,  price reasonable and food is plentiful.

My girl and I popped in after our Friday movie at 8:30. We wait at the front counter for 5 minutes waiting to place our order but nobody came but not for lack of people. There was a girl mopping a spilled drink right by the counter and she never acknowledged us. There was a guy with a mustache that came out from the back and walked the length of counter twice he looked at us but just put his head like we weren't there. Needless to say we're eating Thai food now. Would've loved to try this place but apparently they didn't want our business. Good luck with that business model.

Pretty delicious ramen in Tempe. I had the pork ramen with extra noodles and an egg. The broth was tasty and I added a little sriracha and soy sauce to kick it up a notch. The serving was gigantic and hot (with enough to bring home), I just wish the pork was a little different. It was pretty fatty and the big slices were hard to consume with chopsticks and a spoon.

I desperate search of pho after a cold rainy night led us here as it was the only place open late! We had to wait a while for a someone to free up and grab our order because it was still busy right before closing time. It wasn't pho, but it was good enough to warm my soul with spice and noodles. I've had miso ramen at Kabuki, but this place puts spinach and other veggies in the ramen. I missed the herbs that usually accompany pho to give it a fresh zing, but I can understand as ramen is a totally different cuisine and dish. The ambience was modern Asian with a mysterious, cool vibe. I want to go back to get some snow for dessert because I've heard it is like tasting a sweet/tangy cumulus cloud!

We should have known to turn around when we walked in... It doesn't smell very good and the atmosphere is nothing remarkable. But we were starving, craving ramen, and had ridden our bikes. I had the veggie ramen with tofu and an egg. My girlfriend had the Sapporo ramen with tofu and an egg. Oh, it was just not good. Super bland. Nothing interesting about it. Kind of gross actually. I don't know what else to say. Don't eat here.

My meal here was just OK.  There were a few people in line in front of us, but we waited almost 15 minutes to place our order.  Not sure why it took so long.  At least our food was quickly brought to our table.

There's only one vegetarian option on the menu, which is not ideal.  It was OK, but it seemed like there were an awful lot of bean sprouts in it and not as many noodles as I would have liked.  I quickly finished the noodles and was left with a bowl full of broth and sprouts.  There were just a few small slices of tofu...disappointing for sure.

We also ordered a smoothie, and we waited about 25 minutes for it, longer than it took us to finish our meal.  We ended up taking it with us.  They said it took so long because it took a long time to make the boba, but we ordered ours without boba, and I guess it didn't occur to them to make ours first since they could do it right away.

The restaurant was clean and the food was pretty good, but overall not a satisfying experience.  I'll probably try it again when they've had longer to get their act together.
Excellent and unique food, helpful and friendly employees and very reasonable prices.

I got the vegetarian ramen. The broth was amazing. Very good flavor. However, it took so long for the ramen to come out. Luckily I didn't have a crazy time crunch. Not sure if it was worth the wait or not.

Having grown up experiencing some of the best that San Francisco has to offer in terms of food, I am definitely picky about where I will go to pay for a meal. Thankfully my high expectations were not only met but exceeded when I stumbled upon Republic Ramen. After much though, I decided to order the Shrimp Tempura Udon noodles. After a short wait time, the udon was brought out to me along with the noodles, Naruto, and tempura all packaged in separate containers. I absolutely love it when restaurants take the extra effort to package the foods separately as not to let the food get too soggy too quickly. Albeit there is an environmental concern with all the extra plastic. However, I am here to judge the food, not the restaurant's impact on the world. The broth was full of flavor and warming, exactly what I look for when ordering Udon. The saltiness was perfectly balanced and not overbearing. Onions, scallions, spinach, and seaweed were all fresh and delicious. My only small disappointment was the crunchiness of the tempura, as it was a little soft. This was made up for with the vast tea selection they had available for purchase.

For such great food, the pricing was incredibly reasonable. I ended up paying no more than $11 for a filling, healthy, and extremely flavorful meal. While I have definitely been to cheaper Ramen houses, I could understand the pricing due to Arizona's land locked status. Obviously the shipping cost becomes a factor for any restaurant that wants to serve quality sea food to desert dwellers.

The ambience of the establishment was also very relaxing and welcoming. The rooms are all lit with a soft and dim lighting. Decorations you would expect to find in ramen houses adorn the walls and ceilings. The tables and chairs were all quality made and comfortable to sit on. In addition, there was a seating area for when one was waiting for their food to be cooked (if one was doing take-out instead of dining in).

The atmosphere was inviting. The light smell of ramen and udon broth filled the room, strong enough to make entice one's appetite yet subtle enough to be pleasant. Music also played in the background of the normal restaurant noise. I came at a relatively busy time (in the later afternoon) so I was greeted with a the warm noise of restaurant chatter and conversation. Overall it was a enjoyable area to dine. 
Last but certainly not least was the service. I was greeting by a smiling cashier. Since it was my first time at Republic Ramen I asked for the cashier's recommendations. She went above and beyond by explaining her favorite different types of Udon and Ramen. Once I had ordered my food I took a number and then sat down at one of the tables. My food was promptly brought out to me and the runner thanked me for coming and let me know he hoped I enjoyed the food.

This place is truly superb in all ways! Service was excellent!! First time visiting here the help was very patient in explaining the options and offered several drink options to compliment my dinner. Afterwards I enjoyed a boba slushie that was through the roof! It was somewhat of a slow time and so the waitress was free a lot of the time and had a wonderful time chatting the evening away, though she had no trouble offering the same attention to the other guests!

Noodles were good, but the restaurant is filthy.  Everything I touched had a greasy coating, smell of burnt grease in the air, and the bathrooms...oy, the bathrooms were disgusting.  Plenty of other places that are actually clean, and good.
This place is always super good. Their noodle bowls are HUGE!! And I eat a lot. One bowl will last me two meals. Always a plus.

Coming here with a friend, I hoped for an authenticish Asian food meal. I ordered the shrimp tempura udon. While the shrimp itself was great, the soup was nothing special.  The broth was not flavored or offered any type of spicy zest. The meal was unfortunately bland and a bit too salty for my taste. Additionally, the vegetables were overwhelming within the soup at the lack of meat. For a ramen spot, I have had better for the price of $8. The quantity of food was great but the quality did not follow at this level.

Have to say I will most likely never return to here.

Reason being is that the "service" is horrendous. Walked into the "restaurant," and didn't even get a greeting. Staff was more focused on sweeping/mopping the kitchen/floors behind the counter than to greet my group and direct us how the restaurant works and where we go. (You order and pay first and seat yourselves.)

When odrdering, the girl in a chefs jacket wasn't very knowledgeable about the specifics of each Ramen dish. 

I say this mainly because I had ordered extra pork and charsiu (Chinese BBQ pork) and when my bowl came out there wasn't any hint of it and I was told again, that it's in there, just a different cut of meat. 

In my bowl there was just gray pieces of pork. No telltale red of the charsiu.

The place was also extremely dirty. Trash all over the floors, unbussed tables, tables that had been cleared had food debris/broth in the surfaces.

Dear reviewers reading,
This place is too cute. Very trendy and laid back like as if you stepped into Scott Pilgrim movie very hipster. Sells a limit number of ramen noodles and soups, along with boba teas. With the price they charge you get a ton of anything, never a small portion, I was worried that I was going to get something little or not worth it but was I wrong. The bowls are HUGE HUGE HUGE and comes with a lot. Very delicious and fills one up easy. Really good service they always check on the people to make sure everything is going good in fact my friend accidentally raised her hand barely up and someone came running over to see if she needed anything. 

Down sides would be a tad bit pricey but you get a ton, limited seating if it's a full house it might go bad, little selection of boba teas.

I'm still a little bit hopeful about this place, but I will need to give it another try. Overall, I found my tonkotsu ramen bland and the beef painfully dry. I was very disappointed the toppings were pricey but at least you get a big portion. (Is it just me or isn't egg something mandatory in all ramen bowls?) I wish they had soft boiled eggs but greatful it was soaked in soy sauce and wasn't scambled (like another place that shall remain nameless). The chili pepper ramen was a different story. It packed some heat that gradually intensified as the hot broth warmed the thai chili peppers. I can't say much about the pork my boyfriend ordered with it because he ate it all...

I'm not being harsh but this is not real ramen. The soup looks boring. Ajisen Ramen is average in California but if compares to this place, it would become gourmet ramen. ASU students could use this place for late night dinner instead of fast food or instant noodles though.

New favorite lunch spot. An unbelievable amount of food at a reasonable price. I have lived in Japan and I can honestly say this is the real deal. It is delicious and authentic. You don't really need to know any more. Just go.
The ramaen was ok, The Tonkatsu lacked depth, but it is the only place I know in Arizona that I can get Tonkatsu any day, for that alone it earned 4 stars.
Nice big bowl of Ramen. Beef and Spam sliced thin with tonkotsu and traditional toppings, hit the spot! Great for fast-food ramen!

It is sooo yummy!!! Fresh, warm broth!!! The noodles were nice and soft but not too soft and were just done to break apart in your mouth!! The veggies are perfect and I added an egg and more noodles...how can you have enough, really? Good selection of different kinds of bowls, rice, teas, some beer...not a lot, but some. And all w/in a reasonable price. It's all a nestled in a open seating, for family dining, or couples, or if you just wanna come in and just have a bowl by yourself....I hope you do, IT WORTH IT MY FRIEND???

Ramen here is substandard.  It is by far the worst of 3 Ramen houses in the southeast side of the valley.

This is more of a hangout spot with subpar food.  

The egg was a normal hard boiled egg with gray edges on the yolk, the beef was chewy and lacking of flavor.

It has really gone down hill over the past couple of years.

I came here once before to grab a bowl of warm ramen for a sick friend, and only had their thai milk tea boba (which is really great). I came back last night with a group of friends and had their vegetarian broth ramen with zucchini and a boiled egg. For a (HUGE) bowl of ramen and a boba tea, the total was only $12. I had plenty of leftovers for today. Their broth selection is expansive (even if they only have one vegetarian option) and their add-on's aren't pricey. I'm no ramen expert, and just recently was introduced to it. I've tried ramen at one other local restaurant and I have to say that Republic Ramen is pretty great for the price.
Awesome place for noodles! Been here 3xs and the udon noodles are sooo good! The republic ramen and Tokyo ramen are both delicious! Price is great too!

I walked in and felt like I was in the bar scene of The Gremlins. Chaos.

Started my order. First, out of boba. Ok, fine. I'll have a Thai tea. Nope, the whole tea bar is closed. Why? She didn't tell me that to start. That would've been a little more ok.

Ramen order. Out of egg. Why? That's ridiculous. Who is managing this place? There was a written list of items that were not available taped to the register. Weird.

Counter help walked away to do something else while I was in the middle of my order and with a line of people behind me.

Saw the kitchen from the counter. Looked like a disaster with a couple of guys working that looked like they had not a clue what they were doing.

Ended up walking out. Will not go back.

I've come here many times, but every time the experience has not improved much.

Though flavorful, the broth is always too salty for my taste. The noodles are mediocre; a lot of times they over cook the noodles, resulting in a very mushy noodles in salty broth.

With good pho places nearby, I prefer to get pho most of the time.

Place is just ok when it comes to ramen. It's decently clean and fairly big. Good prices and options. I actually liked the option of spam for the ramen. But, it's definitely not the best ramen place in the area. Biggest disappointment was the egg in the ramen was precooked, hard boiled, and sliced.

I will commend the portions they give you.  They give you A LOT. 
Only if there was flavor. 

Albeit, I came here a week and a half after getting back from a trip to Japan.  I did temper my expectations a lot, but even with those expectations lowered, this was underwhelming. The tables were pretty dirty too.  The service was great.  There is a lot of room for improvement.  

4 Stars for portions, 1 star for flavor.

Maybe I've been spoiled by good ramen joints in Little Tokyo. I got shoyu ramen with extra bamboo shoots. My ramen came out and I finished it before they gave me my almond milk tea. Whoa. 

Chashu is not good. It's super chewy and cardboardy and doesn't melt in your mouth bursting with flavor like it's supposed to. Pork isn't my favorite meat and this place reminds me of why.

I was unsure to expect when i arrived here since it was my first time. The guy at the front was very helpful because i told him it was my first time and had no clue how to order.  I chose my broth which was the spicy one and added beef, corn etc.  It was huge and more than i was expecting.  It was really good.  We ordered Gyoza for our little one and edemame which was a great choice.  It is very nice and clutter free inside.  I ate everything in sight because it was so good. I will definitely be back before i move out of town. I hope to find a place like this in CA.

I really struggle on how many stars to give this place.

On the one hand, there's very, VERY few places to get ramen, saimin, udon, and the like in the Phoenix metro area.  I really appreciate this place as an option!

On the other hand, Republic's ramen is merely fine.  Not amazing, but fine.  It wouldn't pass in Hawaii, but lack of competition here means they'll by default get the business of ramen-cravers like me.  Their broth cannot come close to the savory, complex, authentic ramen I've tried though.  Maybe they're stretching themselves too thin with the bar and dessert/boba options (which I still have no idea how to order).  I'd rather they offer a really solid ramen noodle with either a shio/salt and shoyu/soy broth choice, or even just one absolutely amazing broth.

The "shrimp purse" happy hour appetizer was also simply "fine" and I wouldn't pay the normal price for it.

It would've been four stars but I am taking one off for their inability to cook an egg properly.  Everyone knows the egg should be either soft and runny to ooze it's rich golden yolk over the noodles, OR be made into a seasoned, rolled japanese omelette (tamagoyaki) and sliced super thin.  NOT hard boiled!

Don't expect a lot of customer service, as they're basically operating as a "fast casual" Chipotle-type restaurant.  Some of the tables were not cleared and wiped promptly, despite employees not helping customers.  Count me in as another person who is not a huge fan of the uncomfortable seating

Overall, if I'm in the area and hungry I'll drop by again, but I really don't see myself making a special trip to this side of the valley just to eat here.
The food is decent. The broth is great. The service is meh. The wait time to get your food is ridic.

Food is on point here! Service was good as well. Hubs had the shoyou with spam, a little salty but he loved it. Daughter had the tokoyo with beef which is her regular and she loved it. I had the republic and it was great! The republic was spicy enough to make the nose run but not too hot so you feel like your on fire, perfect balance. We also had the edamame and veggie tempura were aso good. Only drawback for me was that the bathroom was DISGUSTING! Effing disgusting. Seriously have the toilets ever been cleaned? The walls and doors of the stalls were black from the grime. This freaks me out because this has to be the same place your staff washes their hands! Uggh clean your freaking bathroom already!
Great noodles ,nice location, fair prices ,large servings. Chili ramen with traditional topping, very good.
Stopped here before a football game.  Great food, fast service and we were able to get in and out without any problems! The noodles had great flavor and were filling.

First time here. I decided to get the republic ramen traditional with chicken. This place satisfied my ramen craving but the broth was to salty in my opinion. The egg was cold and hard boiled. This place is okay if your just need a quick ramen fix.

I lived in Japan for a few years and a good bowl of ramen was my idea of a perfect meal. It's simple, so everything has to be just right, otherwise it goes into the mediocre category real quick.

This place is ok. There's really nowhere else nearby for ramen, so I guess it's your only choice. The owners are korean and the flavors do seem more korean than japanese.

Love to order any of the soups with udon noodles. Whether it's 115 degrees or 55 degrees, ramen always hits the spot and satisfies the big 'ol soup with noodles craving! Their honey milk tea with boba is purty gewd too!

Good-sized bowl that's decently priced in a build-you-own bowl fashion. You'll get five stars when you have  dedicated seafood ramen on the menu; why in God's green Earth does NOWHERE in Arizona with ramen have this? The mind boggles!

Decent ramen place that's within immediate vicinity of the campus. It's around $8 for a bowl and boba drinks range between $3-5. My favorites are the Tonkotsu Ramen and Chili Pepper Ramen. They are very generous with portions and there's always plenty of meat with my noodles. It's an additional to add extra meat or toppings.They do have other options such as udon and rice. Staff are wonderful and helpful if you need to know something or need them to recommend something delicious. It can be a little dim at night because of the red lights, but I personally love the ambiance.
I love having Republic in the neighborhood. When I'm not feeling well or just want more of a comfort food their tonkotsu ramen is my go to.

Everytime I come to the Phoenix area I make a stop in here for a bowl of tonkotsu ramen with traditional toppings and some gyoza. Some of the better ramen I've had since leaving Las Vegas. If you see the sign and think cup ramen you are dead wrong. After this you will never go back to instant.

Haven't been here in about a year. Was really disappointed since I drove here from chandler. Used to be good. This time it was not even close to being good. 

Got the tonkatsu ramen. The noodles were super soggy and falling apart as I grabbed them with the chopsticks, the broth was extremely salty, and the pork was old. It had a funky taste to it. The only edible part was the extra tofu that I added.

After reading the reviews, I should have known better than to expect good ramen but I was still hopeful.  Sadly, I was disappointed.

I ordered the tonkotsu pork belly with an egg traditional style, as well as edamame and gyozas to share.  The appetizers were cooked well and the best part of the meal.  When the huge bowls were ready, I realized that they gave me the modern version of ramen instead of what I ordered.  The sulky girl behind the counter who took my order originally was not what I wanted to deal with again so I went with it.  There was no depth to the broth and the noodles were not ramen noodles as they were soft and kind of slimy.  The store bought packaged kind is better.  Where was the milky broth made rich and unctuous by hours upon hours of slowly simmered pork bones?  This was a poor introduction to ramen for my friend who never had it before.

I couldn't even eat half of it because it was not good and bland.  When we went to get to go containers since I hate to waste food, the same unhelpful girl asked why we needed two...really?

This was my first time, so I didn't understand how exactly to place my 2 take out orders. The cashier was not helpful at all to explain a rather simple method, these orders then took 30(not even exaggerating) minutes after which I asked to cashier if it Normally took 30 min to which he replied that there were too many orders..let's just say that this was possibly one of the worse customer service experiences I've had.

I've been here twice and all I can say is that it's just OK.  I think it has a lot of potential but it just lacks... lacks decor, ambiance, flavor, etc.  Both times I've been here, the food tasted OK but I feel like it could be so much better.  I only saw 1 TV which was in an awkward position hung near where the drink station is.  The furniture/decor is blah.  With all the little hip places around here, you'd think they'd put a little more into how the restaurant looks.  Anyway, since I'm a mama, maybe I was the only one who noticed that they have fancy Boon High Chairs for the little ones - which made me give them 3-stars and not 2!

This place should be called Rockn Ramen because the music is straight up green day & the ramen is Rockn. It is near the university so I shoulda known it was going to be collagy. But you shouldn't really listen to me about ramen bcus I've had it like twice in my life & the first time the food was scary so I didn't eat it. But I love me some soup and this ramen was SUPER. Even in this 106 heat it still was tasty. 

We came during happy hour & got gyoza & these shrimp purses for a $1 off, I ate like a million of these things. They were perfectly cooked on the crispier side vs dumpling or dim sum way. I got the Tokyo ramen which is a lil bitty hot, not what you think it is and I shared it w/my Tia cuz it was huge. You also get a choice of original or traditional toppings. Not sure what's the difference but I added egg, garlic, corn per suggestion by my sister & that was the way to do it.  Also add some siracha & sesame oil and bam you good!  We also shared the curry rice as a family & ummm not so much. It was a bit thick & no flavor, very floury...yuck! But who goes to ramen & gets curry, no go. We got boba, of course, which I'm not a fan of cuz I can't drink milk & I also feel those Tapioca balls are going to get lodged in my throat accidentally. Everybody else loves it so I support them plus these are my favorite straws so I get sad when I can't have one. 

It was a good family time, enjoyed my first good ramen....happy! The one thing I did find telling was there were no Asians of any kind there, except the ones we brought so hhhhmmmmmm!

Even though I do not eat Asian foods often this authentic bowl was easy to judge. I loved every aspect of the Tokyo beef traditional bowl. The portion was huge and the taste was excellent. I will come back again if I get a chance.
Ramen was tasty and the sake flight (4 sake) was inexpensive. However, theAlmond Milk Tea with boba was horrid.

Finally tried this place - I had the pork broth & my wife had the miso broth... you could barely tell them apart.  Both were totally bland, the pork was tasteless, the egg way overcooked, even the gyoza was overdone and plain.  Plus the place was dirty.. at least the beer was cold.

My son was dying to try a ramen noodle soup from this place.  He opted for Republic Ramen with pork--it is one of the spicy ones.  It comes with spinach and a bunch of other veggies.  I opted for an order of pork gyoza.  
The bowl was large containing a large amount of a soy sauce based broth.  It had one slice of pork.  He seemed to enjoy the ramen but left most of the broth.  I had an opportunity to taste the broth and it was just ok.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  The gyoza, on the other hand, were super delicious--gingery, garlicky and porky. The dipping sauce was super salty. 
The place was dimly lit with a reddish lighting that gave a calmness to the place.  I saw lots of students eating their bowls of soups so I take it that this is an ASU hangout.  
I personally would not make a special trip to eat here again although the soup was not terrible.  It's just that there are other places that probably will offer a better soup for a better value.

I choose this location for date night. I was very excited, the place has a nice vibe, but the food wasn't the best. My spicy Ramen was just blah. Might give them another chance and just try something different.

I give this place a four star, just because it give pretty ok ramen, at the location, Tempe. You can't really find real Japanese food around Tempe,  It was interesting how we can chose our meat from, pork,beef, tofu, spam, and chicken. normally pork would be the best choice (chashu) but it's an idea to have little different taste for ramen. Definitely coming back, when I visit Tempe

Found my BOBA spot!

They have Snow, Slush & Tea options. The are generous with the tapioca balls inside.

The staff is very knowledgeable too about Boba flavors and combinations.

Average price around $3.50.

Get extra bowls or a to-go container you wil need them. 

HUGE portions which scores points for me always. The food is great too. No, it's not authentic, but if you're just looking for some feel-good food come here. Portions are huge which is why it costs a bit (up to nine bucks after tax) but their best item is actuallt their cheapest the plain udon at under seven bucks after tax. 

Their udon noodles are super thick you won't miss the meat. I have very Americanized tase buds I'll admit, but to me the broth is super tasty. I put in a cup of chili oil and it's bliss in a bowl. 

Also gets points for atmosphere very clean, for just a few dollarsmore than fast food it's actually a place you can enjoy sitting in and spending time.

This is my absolute favorite ramen place. I strongly recommend the republic ramen, it has a bit of a kick to it but oh my goodness is it tasty. The portions are large, which is great for me because I love soup. The boba is fresh and delicious. The staff is always nice and food comes out pretty quickly. There are many different ways you can customize your ramen to fit your tastes! If you love ramen, or soup in general, this place is for you!

My favorite local ramen joint! Very affordable for a great portion! The staff are always friendly & helpful. I eat here all the time & have never once been disappointed. I just had my leftovers for lunch today & they were delicious!

Best ramen spot I've been to so far since moving to Phoenix. Just shut up and get the tonkatsu traditional style or else you'll get spinach and carrots in your ramen and wonder what went wrong in your life. Kimchi and seaweed salad were actually pretty good, too, and this is coming from a girl raised on her granny's homemade kimchi. Prices ranged about 8-9 bucks per ramen. The cashier had no idea what I was talking about when I asked about the egg ($1 extra but worth it if it's the ooey gooey-just-cooked-ebough good stuff). I was sad when it came out hardboiled, but flavor was still good (marinated in soy sauce). Definitely go here if the wait at a certain ayce kbbq joint around the corner has a two hour wait for three people, or if you're craving some great ramen.

Like many people, I grew up on cheap, 5/$1 Ramen noodles.  Everyone had their "special" way of making them in the hood and no two ways were the same.  However, until you have a real bowl of Ramen, you don't realize just how bad your version is!

Republic takes Ramen to another level.  The bowls are large, hot and stuffed with multiple fresh ingredients.  While the dine in experience is somewhat spartan, it is a perfect spot to sit and enjoy a nice lunch without the usual jammed packed scene that many University area restaurants enjoy.  The Boba menu is also a plus if you never had one - Try Green Apple.
I'm obsessed. Miso base with tons of veggies and noodles. The servings are huge, enough for a couple of meals for me. They have chili oil and tropical ice tea. Great lunch spot.

First time patron. Confused as to whether to seat ourselves or to order at the counter then, seat ourselves.  Took a while to get help for someone to take our order(at the counter).  Went really late, so other staff may have been sent home earlier.  Nice selection of noodle bowls such as ramen,  soba or udon. Didn't take long.  Huge portion, great price, good music( Pearl Jam) selection, chill guy as a cashier, food runner,  and busser. He seemed timid, but very kind.  Gyoza was deep fried; I like mine pan fried then steamed.  Dimly lit place(didn't care for). Good stuff.

I have been looking for a Ramen place in Phoenix, and was driving by and thought I would give this place a try. 

Well, it was worth a shot. 

To start, this is a walk-up and order restaurant, not wait-staffed. Ok. No big deal.

I asked what the house special was and they suggested:
Tonkotsu Ramen
Rich pork flavored broth.
Original Toppings
Fresh spinach  Sprouts  Scallions Carrots 
Traditional Toppings
Men-ma  Bamboo shoots  Nori  Naruto Scallions  

The broth was just ho-hum. I added some soy and sriacha to spice it up, but still, nothing great about it. Just average. 

Noodles - fresh straight from a bag, not made here.
Toppings - just sad and boring. No egg. I haven't ever had carrots or spinach on Ramen before.. but these are just bland and sad.

What I couldn't get over was how dirty the floors were. I get they are travertine and all the dirt is in the imperfections, but the baseboards, floors, everything is just really dirty and dingy. Nope. Won't be going back.

I have only had the tea here but it is pretty good and they are open late on the weekends! This is the only boba place open till 10 pm which is about the time I find myself craving a tea:) The staff is awesome! The place is clean and newly remodeled. They have a new expanded tea menu which is nice. The boba has never been "perfect" though, it is always a little too chewy and somewhat over cooked. A couple of times I have gotten teas where the boba was in a big solid lump at the bottom of my glass. Not optimal. BUT over all it is a good place with a great vibe.

When the weather here in AZ dipped, I thought something warm would be nice. Naturally ramen sounded like it would do the trick, so i gave this place a chance. 

I ordered the Sapporo Ramen (Sweet Butter corn in miso flavored broth) with original toppings & beef. The veggies were all good except for the carrots which were past their prime. While the soup was warm and flavor was so so, i just wasn't blown away by anything. The staff was not very pleasant and seemed annoyed by all my questions with their menu. 

This place is just okay, nothing really special or unique about it.

Grew up on instant ramen, had ramen in New York at some hole in the wall Japanese place where we literally got seated in a closet, found out there was a ramen place south of me in Tempe.

The staff is nice and service is quick. I had a big get together here with around 15 people and everyone got served fairly quickly. As for the food itself, it's a step up from the cups of instant noodles, but nothing special.

This was the first place I've tried ramen, so I don't have much to compare it to, but I enjoyed my  Tonkotsu topped with pork and egg. After a few bites I definitely wanted to punch it up with some chili oil, though. The portions are large. The customer service is unfortunate, but you don't really expect much walking in seeing twice as many staff as customers chatting bored behind the counter.

Very average ramen with not a lot of toppings.  The boba slush drinks were also very average (would prefer if it was blended more-crushed ice texture).  The food came quick, and prices are decent. 

There are a variety of meats to choose from (to top the ramen with) such as chicken, spam, tofu, etc. and they are generous with the quantity of meat. For fast food its not bad.

I've been here quite a few times with an ex while living in Tempe a few years ago. They serve YUGE bowls of steamy, brothy ramen. I always got the pork flavor broth with pork as well as egg and naruto. They may serve too big portions though as it easily fills me up and I only eat half of it.
