I had the Chili Ramen with Beef, Traditional Toppings, 8/10 spiciness, and Dude had the Republic Ramen with Beef, also with Traditional Toppings. 

These bowls are HUGE and we could have easily shared one, but hey, lunch leftovers for work the next day. 

Plenty of kick from that spice, and the beef was not fatty at all. Thinly sliced and tender. The noodles were just right, not overcooked. 

I'm no ramen expert, but damn, this was yummy. 

So mad we overlooked this joint for so long. Will definitely be back, and dragging my ASU brother along for a nice free meal on the big sis!

If you want a salt fix in liquid form, this is the place for you. I had the Tonkatsu ramen and it was ALARMINGLY salty, to the point where I just gave up halfway through the bowl (and probably should have done so earlier). The noodles and toppings were pretty good but even for a salt lover like me, the broth was much too much. Bad start to my ramen search in Phoenix. Points for a clean, modern atmosphere inside the restaurant, but I won't be back.

So delicious! My sister got the Republic Ramen with chicken and it was a little spicy but so good. I got the Chili Pepper Ramen with beef. The beef was thinly sliced and super yummy! I actually liked my sisters ramen flavor more but both were great!

Another ramen joint trying to capitalize on the uber popular ramen craze. This place screams, "We're in the business to make money, not food!" The interior looks like a cobbled up mess, at least the boba serving side did. Speaking of which, why is this place attached to a boba store? 

The ramen here is mediocre at best. I have had much better ramen both in the East Coast (Ippudo, Totto, etc.) and the West Coast (Daikokuya, etc.) within the same price range. The tonkotsu ramen, which apparently is there best seller, did not have any depth in the broth. The noodles were bloated/somewhat soggy and there additional sides were just awful (ex. What should have been menma (fermented bamboo shoots) was just plain hard bamboo cut up). Lets not forget the char siu, which I guess to them is non-roasted thinly sliced pork similarly used in Korean bbq. 

In summary, yes this place is better than your $.10-$.25 bag of ramen, but $7-$8? I don't think so. I only came here since I frequent AZ for business and it was a chilly day which in turn made me crave something soupy. As a Japanese American, I searched for the perfect Japanese comfort food to fulfill my soup craving. Unfortunately, all I found was a mediocre noodle joint which falsely represented the traditional Japanese noodle soup dish.

I've tried other ramen and pho places, but I keep coming back to Republic Ramen! It is my go to place for a delicious Japanese-style Ramen. There are numerous choices for additional  ingredients to make your soup extra special for an additional $.50 to $1.50. Today I ordered  the spicy Tokyo Ramen with pork, adding in extra bamboo shoots, green onions, and double of their toothsome noodles to the broth. You have a choice of original  or traditional Japanese ingredients in your broth. Yum! Meats are slice super thin plus they also offer tofu, if you prefer. Besides traditional sodas, they have two great flavored ice teas, and a variety of delicious Boba teas so you can drink dessert with you lunch! ( The "Sno" desserts shop is now  attached to Republic Ramen. Try one and fall in love---  Chocolate, mango, coffee, melon ---similar to shaved ice but 100 times better!!!
The facilities are pretty basic but clean and the crew is helpful with any questions. Must. Go. Back. Soooon !

This was my go-to spot for Ramen in college. I love their ramen, but just be aware that if you are adding topping to what is already included in the bowl, it can start to get a little bit pricey! Yummy food and quick service!

The staff were very nice.  I must have had a miscommunication with the cashier because I specified I'd like pork, and she took that to mean I wanted extra pork, apparently, because of the biil.  I should have said something before I paid because the price didn't add up, but whatever, that's kind of on me.

I thought the broth was very good.  The soba was pretty good.  My bowl was humongous, inappropriately so. I left half of the broth after finishing my noodles and everything else.  If there was "extra pork" then it must be pretty skimpy on the reg., or they just gave me the regular amount and charged me for extra.  For a regular portion it was fine.  I really just wanted more noodles to go with the sea of broth.

The place seemed super clean.  The clientele seemed like the sort you'd see in a Stuff White People Like blog post.  That's not a good or a bad thing.

Awesome place if you want a big bowl of REAL ramen, not the 25 cent packages you make at home. Been here a couple times already and every time the staff is very friendly and our food comes out pretty fast! They have house saki that comes in every flavor that the house teas come in! Not a big fan of boba, but if you are they have tons of selection for you!

I have to agree with several other traveled reviewers on here and say that the ramen here is very MEH.
I only eat here because there are very few ramen places in the phoenix area and my friends like ramen. The flavor, texture of the noodles, and warmth of the broth is really not there and that is what ramen is supposed to be about! However, I must commend them on their large portion sizes because they do give you a really big bowl. 
This place isn't going anywhere because ASU is nearby.

If you have to HAVE ramen and don't want to drive, then fine, get it here. But there are definitely other options that are better in the valley.

I LOVE Republic Ramen. I have been holding my birthday and friends' surprise birthday parties here now for a couple of years, because the food is delicious and inexpensive, the staff are very nice, and among my friends and I, we all just love ramen. My typical order is a tonkotsu ramen (very rich, creamy pork broth) and a thai iced tea boba! It is absolutely delicious, and even while writing this review, I am now craving some ramen from here. I have tried to recreate their tonkotsu broth at my home with no such luck! It is simply the best from here!

Also, for me personally, Cherry Blossum cafe was not nearly as good as Republic Ramen, it was just not as satisfying in the broth. I know everyone is different, but that is just my two cents! I will continue recommend Republic Ramen to all of my friends!

Saw them on Check, Please Arizona.
I got the rame that starts with a 'T' and it isn't the Tokyo one.  
It was...decent.  Nothing to rave about but still a good meal; 7 out of 10.
Also ordered the gyoza and they were well cooked and flavorful.  Sauce was nondescript.
The service consisted of ordering at the cashier and having our food brought to us.  Both experiences were perfectly fine, and the cashier (Vanessa?) was very friendly.
Two others ate with me and they both commented that their ramen was good but they've had better.  I can't remember which ones they ordered but one had a very light broth and the other an almost brown broth.  
I must say it was all fresh.  The ingredients were not skimpy and the portion size was big.  
A very middle-of-the-road experience.
Atmosphere is very open and public with big benches and tables inside, and a small area outside to eat at.
If you like ramen, I can't highly recommend this place but I would say you could do much worse.

I only came here because Shady Park was closed and it was a terrible experience. After I ordered within two minutes I got my food- but it was the wrong order- the person who brought it to me noticed that it was missing the egg but didn't notice that it was entirely the wrong meat and broth. Regardless he didn't come back and I had to carry my huge bowl of ramen to the counter. 30 seconds later I got my actual order and the girl exclaimed "they re-made it for you" and brought me a side of cold hard boiled egg. The whole reason to pay the extra $1 for egg is to get a hot soft boiled egg in your broth. The egg was gray in the middle from being over-boiled. The soup itself was awful to say the least, and you have to eat it with disposable chopsticks and a metal ramen spoon. Now on top of it my boyfriend and I both have an upset stomach from eating here. Avoid this place, there's plenty of good ramen in Tempe.

Very big portions, with flavorful, distinct broth options.  My favorite broth so far is the tonkatsu ramen.  There are a lot of different add-ons you can put in the soup, and I was happy to see that they had tea eggs on the menu!  They also have bubble tea, but the tapioca I had tasted old and soggy, and it was very flavorless (taro milk tea).  The tempura is also very good- very crispy with fresh vegetables.
Add instant ramen, add a slice of beef, commercialize it as hip, sell for 8 dollars = Satanism. No Thank You Republic Ramen, No Thank You and Never Again.

Coming from Seattle with lots of good Japanese food, and moved to the desert, gives me a bit of pessimistic thoughts about this place. It is the only ramen place in Phoenix and just opened this March. We visited this place for lunch on Sunday. But after entering the door and feel the atmosphere, I had a good feeling already. The cashier was so passionate about his products and explained how the menu works in 3 minutes presentation, very impressive... I tried what he recommended , the tonkatsu noodle, the usual choice I make in Seattle. The price was cheap too for the huge portion they serve ($6.95/bowl). This is definitely a place to hang out if you want to not spend lots of money but still going home full. 
I love his recommendation! And we tried the shrimp tempura appertizer as well, and the garlic sweet sauce is just addictive! 
I recommend this place and definitely will come again!

I had the Republic Ramen with original toppings and tofu. The broth was my favorite part because it had just the right amount of heat. I really enjoyed the ramen just beware that the portions are huge! I also got the mango snow boba. It was a little too sweet for my taste but still very delicious. The food came really fast, went here at around 7 pm.

The ramen is mediocre--all of it needs added sauce/powder to really give it a kick. I like all the seemingly fresh veggies. After dinner I went to the ladies room. It's disgusting and looks like a gas station bathroom. The lights were off and when I turned them on several COCKROACHES scurried about. I wanted to vomit, I had just eaten, had it been before I'd of demanded my money back and bailed. Gross.

This places is AWESOME!! I have tried a lot of their items on the menu now and you have to try it! It is so filling and tastes delicious. At night it's a nice atmosphere and I love to come here with my husband and spend some time together eating our ramen! Try the Shoyu Ramen with original toppings and add corn, you won't regret it!

Decor was nice, with a modern touch.

Customer Service:

Walked into the restaurant, and went straight to the counter. I immediately asked if I can sit myself. I did, thinking there was going to be a waiter who would take my order. I waited a few minutes and noticed that people are lining up to the counter placing their orders before sitting themselves. So, I stood up and went behind the line. This time, Im the 8th customer on the line. The person behind the counter (Barclay with a brit accent) didnt bother to tell me that I have to order from the counter and then sit myself...WTF! Employees seems  like ASU students who couldnt care less about what we say with regards to their customer service skills. No enthusiam at all. I dont blame them, this isnt their career anyway. They are just passing by. Try ramen houses in Los Angeles area, the servers are as enthusiastic as the servers in Japan.  Yes, I have lived in Japan for 4 years, thats how I know.

Thai Tea w/ boba:
How can someone F this up anyway? It's good.

The Ramen: ( had the miso ramen with pork)
I guess its good for being in AZ. The broth actually has a flavor, powdered flavor. I didnt like the pork tho. Their ramen includes a spinach, a welcome difference/change and I liked it.


My biggest pet peeve from a "ramen house," is when they use disposable chopsticks and plastic bowls!!!! And yes, Republic Ramen is guilty of these.


If youre expecting an authentic ramen from this place, you might just as well be disappointed.


Another employee gave me the thai tea for free, because someone forgot to prepare one for me. I offered to pay, but he said its okay and not to worry about it.
Easy going Atmosphere. One the best Ramen I have had in years (that is not homemade or in Japan). The soup base taste perfect the way it is, no additional sauce needed!
Their Raman is not professional, and not even near professional. The tastes are all different every time I came for the same item. Too salty this time...I mean really salty! Disappointed...

Eh, this place is pretty solid, but I'd have to come here again to give it a higher star rating. As it stands, I'd have to agree with the people who said that the broth isn't really all that complex. It's fine, but it tastes more like it came from a dehydrated packet than from a huge stockpot in the back full of pork bones, roasted veggies, and spices. I might be wrong, but I just wasn't overwhelmed. I had the Republic ramen bowl with pork, and it was fine. The noodles were really good, but I was hoping for a slightly spicier broth. The rest of the ingredients were fine as well, and the bamboo shoots were nice and decently firm. If I came here again, tried another bowl, and enjoyed it, I'd easily give this place another star, but I wasn't impressed enough with what I had to give it a solid four-star rating. As it is, though, it's not bad, and a decent place for lunch if you don't mind a bit of the 'itis' after some slurping.

I think the concept is good but I wasn't impressed with the staff or the prices.  Flavor-wise it was adequate but not food that brings me back for more.  In fact, while eating I was thinking:  I could have had a bowl of tom yum pork instead elsewhere for the same price and from much more friendly people...  It's not full service; you order at a counter.

This place has good ramen and very good vegetable tempura. The service kills the whole experience unfortunately. The employees are disgruntled, inattentive and over all give off a "I don't want to be here and don't want to assist you" vibe. I had to repeat my self several times, wasn't asked if I had any questions yet alone greeted. At least fake the service and act like you want to be here. Overall a terrible experience simply due due to the atrocious service.

Great food, great people, great atmosphere.... i could go on! My daughter loves boba snow and Tony makes it the best. They have tons of teas too! The RAMEN IS VERY YUMMY! Plenty to share with someone!

I've been here a handful of times with friends and definitely recommend it. The food is decent, the portions are huge, and it's never too crowded. One of my biggest fears when eating out is not being full when I leave, and that is especially true at noodle houses; however, Republic Ramen serves their noodles up in gigantic bowls that will challenge you to finish them and slurp up all that you can.

Ramen is what you make of it, and you aren't doing yourself any favors if you don't add some spices. Be adventurous and don't be afraid to try things that you can't pronounce. You'll thank me later.

P.S. the attached boba bar is decent. It may not be the best boba in the world, but the huge variety of flavors that they will let you mix and match can lead to some surprisingly savory drinks!

I was SHOCKED at the size of the bowls here!

For some reason, the pictures don't really capture the how much food you actually get.

Me, wife daughter and 18 month old son came here for my birthday dinner ( Don't ask how old I am, I will lie)

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen..original toppings..added pork, and extra bamboo shoots.
Also got an order of Gyoza. Lemme tell ya...I could have eaten 5 plates of those bad boys!
The broth was delish, but was rather subdued.  That can be a good thing, if you have an aversion to excess sodium. I took the leftover dipping sauce for my gyoza, and poured it into my ramen. Perfect!
The sliced pork was really tender.
To drink, I got the Green Apple Boba tea, with green tea.
YUMM!!  My daughter got the passion fruit, and that was super yummy, too!
The only reason I gave 4 stars and not 5, is that I DO have an aversion to excess sodium. Hahah. 
Regardless, we will be back.

Got here at 7:45pm on a Saturday and didn't get our food until 8:40pm (party of 2 only). This place was almost full with only 3 empty tables.

I had a glimpse of the kitchen on my way to the restroom and noticed only one guy in the kitchen. He had bowls of ramen lined up and seemed to be  haphazardly tossing toppings into each bowl...with his BARE HANDS. If you are going to do that I expect my Ramen to be ready in 10 minutes. 

Quality of Ramen is below average. The temperature of the broth was lukewarm, not the typical hot of most ramen places. The ingredients in the Ramen were mediocre to say the least. NO complimentary HALF-EGG??? I guess this is what you should expect when you pay $8 for a bowl.
Awesome ramen! Flavorful broths and toppings. Noodles are great too. Love this place.

East and West coast people who are mourning a decent Ramen place look no further. Delicious food, good sides. The best tempura I have had in a long time.  Casual yet hip place. Great service. Great place!

I can't believe a Japanese person could eat an entire bowl of this ramen but the waitperson insisted it is authentic. I have to give it to them -- it's the best ramen I've ever had!

When you walk in, there's a certain way of ordering. You pick a base soup and then add ingredients. If you are having any trouble figuring it out, the helpful staff, with names like Shiloh and Moonbeam will be glad to help you out.

The huge bowls are reasonably priced and extremely filling, so if you order a side dish, you can forget about finishing. Probably better to go in knowing you'll come out with half of it left over for dinner.

I barehand a slim slice of the melt in your mouth beef from the mound and dip it in sriracha sauce, devouring it in one bite. I prefer the traditional toppings. Nori seaweed, a root veggie I can't identify, Naruto (kage bunshin no tasty!) and plenty of scallions. Get an egg upgrade because they offer high-end brown eggs, the egg yolk ups the ante for richness in your broth and compliments the salty undertones.

A number of other yelpers fault RR for being too salty; yet they fail to realise salt is a key component of a well executed ramen. You can also balance it out with sriracha sauce. All toppings have been fresh, the broth is always piping hot. There is a lot going on yet everything compliments each other. There is diversity between each bite using your spoon for customization. Even with the restaurant 2/3rds full my ramen came to me in just over 5 minutes.

I'm 6'4 280 and its a challenge for me to take down these portions making RR an insanely strong value. You're looking at between $7-9 for your ramen plus a delicious egg.

Only one gripe. Make the courtesy water cup size bigger, its kinda annoying considering that this food does have high salt content and I can maybe get 3ish sips before its empty. I may bring in my BPA free water jug so this is no longer an issue but I don't want to start a confrontation.

If you have any allergies or diet restrictions, do not go here. The staff was not very helpful to us and thought the answer "I am not sure" was satisfactory! After talking to four different people, we were able to order. The food itself was pretty good and comes in large portions.

I've always enjoyed coming here because ramen is sooooo good
It is not the .10 cent bags you can make on your own... 
I must say that these are huge bowls and I recommend one bowl to two people. They are huge! My favorite is the Tonkotsu Ramen which is a pork flavored broth and I add pork meat. Ramen would be the perfect "sickness" meal or the perfect "hangover" meal. I love that they have chili powder and Sriracha that you can add into your bowl. I must say that I do not like the small water cups though, they are tiny. Other than that everything is wonderful and I hope you enjoy your bowl of ramen :)
Best hangover meal I can think of is a streaming bowl of spicy ramen from Republic.

I love ramen, and I am not talking about the cheap garbage you buy from the grocery store.  I love the good stuff, and Republic Ramen does it right.

I ordered the extra spicy Republic Ramen with chicken, and it was great.  I enjoyed it so much.  Every drop of the soup was a symphony of sensation on my taste buds.  I was in heaven, but I am getting ahead of myself.

We started the dinner with an order of Shrimp Purses and Gyoza.  The price was four and three dollars respectively, and they came out in a hurry.  They were fresh, and they were great.  They were gone in a flash.

The main course was in a gigantic bowl, and that was way more than I could eat in a sitting.  I mostly ate the excellent broth, and I took the rest home to eat that night.  Man, I loved that place so much.  I will definitely go there again.

A+++ in my book!

Maybe it's because it's the middle of summer and all the ASU kids are gone, but this place was pretty dead for dinner.  The ramen was okay.  The broth was not as temperature-hot as I would have preferred.  But the gyoza was quite delicious.  I was disappointed that the ramen was not as flavorful as I expected.  I'd come back, but maybe next time, I'd set lower expectations.

For those who likes ramen must try Nishikawa Ramen. Unlike this Republic Ramen, customer service is horrible. I simply asked for extra noodle on the side and extra egg... They gave me my bowl with just broth and 1 set of noodles, with no extra, on the side. So they remade my order. My remade order has 2 sets of noodles, but 0 eggs. The kid w/ acne scars who took my order said, "I asked you if you want your noodles on the side. I work here all the time!."

This place has improved tremendously, the quality and flavor is much better than it had been, it tastes like when they first opened. The menu had also been expanded. For anyone who hasn't been I recommend you give it a try and anyone who had been put off by a prior visit, I suggest you give Republic another chance.. Maybe try something different this time. The tonkotsu was great with te addition of corn and an egg, and the Sopporo was pretty good too. To even out the review I will say I'm not sure why they decided they needed to shower the kimchi with scallions or why the seaweed salad was so sweet, not in a bad way, just different. they need to perfect their noodles a bit, but it won't stop me from coming back.  :)

I had to eat here at least once, and would eat here more often if it were in a more convenient location for me.  Have you ever wanted to try real ramen?  News flash -- the 99 cent packages of "ramen" at the grocery store is just about one of the worst things you can stick into you body and can hardly be called food at all.  If you feel insulted by this sentence, then I would not recommend Republic Ramen + Noodles, but if you were intrigued by my question, look up the address immediately.  Besides, and I haven't done extensive research on this, but I believe that instant ramen in Japan comes with the broth, which leads me to believe that they don't even have what we call "ramen" in Japan.  For those who are neither insulted nor intrigued, just keep in mind that you are ordering soup for your meal.  If that won't fill you up, consider an appetizer.  There are a variety of styles and ingredients that you must select from.  Naturally, I ordered naruto with my ramen.  The reason for this will be left unpublished.  All that is missing is counter side dining with privacy drapes.

Who knew Ramen could be so much fun? I came here for the first time last night with John C, and I absolutely loved it!  Both of us had not been feeling well lately, and he suggested we come here to self medicate and that the food was awesome.  I loved it!  

I really like how this place is decorated.  It feels comfortable, with benches and chairs, plenty of seating and a fair amount of room to move in.  No blasting music, very relaxing, but it feels clean and nice.

Anyways, I have never been here before, so in between my friend and the girl behind the counter, I was able to figure out what it was I wanted.  They have a ton of options, from meatless dishes, to stuff with chicken, pork, and even alcohol options to drink as well.   I went with a vegetable clear broth with chicken chunks, and my friend ordered a vegatarian thing since he doesn't eat meat.  They answered all my questions and gave me a lot of options to choose from.  Staff here is patient, and seems to not only know their menu, but take the time to answer questions to make sure your happy with what you order.

The food came out in a HUGE bowl.  It's like eating a hearty bowl of soup, with tons of good stuff in it.  I got through about half, and was STUFFED.  my friend ate about three quarters, and was stuffed as well.  We both have leftovers!  Total bill with drinks was about $20.  love it! I can eat a hearty meal, with left overs and not break the bank!

Will be back in the future, weather its just for dinner, or drinks as well.  Go here and try this place!
just wanted to try it to see what it was like. it's nothing to write home about. the food is ok, but a little pricey for what you get, in my opinion.

Love coming here and love eating in. Just wish that they had sturdier take out containers (bigger ones too) and that they didn't separate the noodles and the broth when it's take out. Otherwise, eating in is great. Only reason I docked a star is that it would be nice if they wouldn't let people clip their nails in a restaurant as not only is that totally disgusting, but I'm pretty sure that's gotta be violating some sort of health code. Love this place anyway. 

Oops, also forgot. Sometimes nobody picks up the phone even if you call repeatedly and you'll get their voicemail which is full. Aaaand the chicken was not great at all (I compare it to the likes of the chicken in canned soup but worse and blander) so I always order mine without any meat. Otherwise, still love it.

Never thought much about Ramen noodles and how you can really make a meal of it.  Generally, it's one of those college foods you eat when you're dead broke and starving.  I can appreciate taking a simple dish and making it the main feature of the restaurant.  The noodles here is good and spicy I must say - if you need more spice; grab yourself a bottle of Siracha.  I can't handle my spice like I used to and it was just right for me.  Decor was simple Ikea like furniture - nothing wrong as long as it works.  Service was good with a friendly smile.  If I ever need another Ramen fix and feel lazy to make my own - I know where to go now.  There's a little boba shop connected to Republic so don't forget to grab some with your meal.  Enjoy!

I came here from out of town and I had a really good experience. Tom was dope, he went above and beyond to help my family with our orders.  The boba was bomb and the ramen was pretty good. Tom was a really good guy and made our experience super dope.

First time coming, I saw the place twice coming out of Tempe Improv and was always curious. Met a girl on tinder and we agreed to meet at this place since we both never tried it. The guy at the cashier was very nice and helpful. I was nervous and I she was as well. We both orders the miso one which was to die for. It was so good. If I didn't have a beautiful chick in front of me I would of devoured that bowl like a Game of Thrones character who hasn't ate for months. I love it and will def be going back. Plus you guys popped my Ramen noodle cherry!

Republic is great. The service is fantastic and they truly bust their ass to bring the customer the highest quality ramen in this part of town. The prices are fantastic as you can get a huge bowl of delicious ramen for a mere $7 max. When I went I got the tonkotsu (awesome pork broth) with pork and naruto (I would also recommend, of course, an egg but they took all their eggs out of circulation because of a state?wide or countywide recall).

Really cool honesty and professional call on that as even though, as our waiter explained, that their eggs were organic and locally raised and completely unaffected it was better to be safe than sorry and save face if somebody were to ask questions concerning the eggs, BUT I digress. 

The ramen was made FAST and served beautifully. The fixings, condiments, and utensils were all abundant, varied, and self-serve and I found that so convenient and well thought-out. Drinks are cheap and self-served and their boba was great. 

I highly recommend the mango-almond snow and the taro-blueberry snow. My only con to the boba would have to be that it's a bit of a wait (between 10 and 20 minutes) but that's only because they have to boil the tapioca to order but at least you know you're getting a good product made fresh. Either way, it's a ramen joint and there aren't too many places around the Tempe ASU campus that sells boba, nonetheless fantastic tasting boba like this place. Best way to do it is to order your boba for dessert about halfway through your ramen so you can have sweet slushy finish to your salty, warm broth dinner. Drink water during your ramen as to not muddle and disrespect the ramen's flavor.

Service was great and really you can't ask for more than a friendly-face and enthusiastic service in a cheap high pace college ramen joint that is beautifully decorated and cranking out delicious soups minute after minute for the hordes of broke college kids and hungry twenty-somethings looking for something else than In-N-Out. 

Grab your girl or dude, order some ramen, get some boba, sit back, and enjoy.

Had the republic ramen with original toppings and pork (on recommendation from the girl at the counter). Good bowl of soup, never had ramen before except the .25 cent bags. Wasn't a fan of the pork, too much fat for me but the noodles and vegetables were great. Will I come back? Sure, but 9 times out of 10 I'll drive around the corner and get Pho instead.

The freshly made broth is amazing!  I've had 3 different ones so far and they are all great!  I personally love the thick udon noodles too.  The Thai Tea boba could have been better.  One order of soup really feeds 2 people or a 2nd serving at home.

Tried this place for the first time last night and it was Really good! Of course not as good as you get in Japan or like even Ippudo in NYC but it is the best I have found in AZ and defiantly fulfilled my ramen craving! Not sure why they got so many bad reviews? Maybe they have improved since first opening? Anyways I had the tonkatsu with traditional toppings and an egg. Pros- rich yummy porky broth, perfectly chewy noodles, bomb bamboo shoots and naruto! ( the little swirls make me so happy ) cons- pork could be more tender and the egg was NOT a proper ramen egg. It should have a soft medium yolk not a dry crumbly yolk. Overall though I was so happy with my big bowl of ramen! Very delicious! Costumer service was fine not wow but not bad. We will defiantly be going back!

Got the chili pepper ramen and it was yummy!   Perfectly spicy and packed with flavor.  

Minus a few stars for the ordering process (for some reason it took forever and the cashier seemed to be confused), the boba (just not as delicious as I'm used to), and the fact that the beef was in one massive strip that was way too big to eat in one bite, but too tough to easily break up.

Will definitely be coming back for the ramen!

I really enjoyed my experience here. Right when we walked in they guy at the counter was super helpful. He explained the menu to us, gave us his suggestions, and gave very detailed descriptions of everything they have. I had the tonkotsu ramen, spicy, and my dining companion had the republic ramen, spicy as well, both with pork. We grabbed our drinks (best iced tea ever!) and found a table. The place was modern, and most importantly very clean. Our orders arrived quickly in gigantic steaming bowls. While my fiances noodles were delicious, I defiantly out ordered him, my tonkotsu broth was heavenly. I loved all the veggies and the noodles were just right. And we both had enough for lunch the next day! 


By the way, Ive been twice now and Ty has been working the counter both times. I hope the rest of the employees are even half as friendly and knowledgeable as he is! Every time I have a question he gives a very informative answer and always seems to be pretty passionate about it too.

Love this place for the vegetarian ramen! Portions are pretty big. This place always has a long line when you get to the counter. I've been disappointed the past 2 times I have gone I have paid for extra zucchini toppings and took my to-go order home only to find the toppings were missing. The only other thing I ever have a problem with is how unprofessionally they answer their phone for to go orders. A simple "how can I help you?" would go a long way..

My husband and I saw this place about a year ago and wanted to try it but since we live in the North Valley its not often we are in the east valley together. We went with some friends and it was ..ok. It wasn't fantastic, the portions on soup were generous, but the Shrimp tempura was 3 pieces for 4.00. It was good though. Maybe I expected too much? For advertising that it was a real ramen place I expected to leave that think to myself I have to go back there!

Good service though. The girl behind the counter was knowledgeable, and the food came out fast and hot.

Certainly better then your pre-packaged 50cent Ramen you get from the store but I am not sure I would decide to spend my money here again when there are so many different places that are yummier.

Stopped on for the first time! Staff was helpful
To tell me what I should get after I told them what I liked. Service was fast we walked in and about three or four groups walked in behind us. Our food came out quick and everyone was very friendly! The food was good I felt like it was super salty I actually dumped some of the broth out and added water to help. I'll be back, but maybe I'll try something different!

The rating pretty much speaks for itself it was 'A-OK', the flavor was honestly not very different from a package of ramen noodles for a few cents. Although, the sides of corn, spinach, etc are lovely and fresh. Could probably actually just make this at home using the ramen noodles! You get a HUGE amount of food in the bowl, I nowhere near finished. Overall, not a bad place, but nothing spectacular I would recommend either.

Had to try RR as we love ramen and use to frequent a Japanese market/grocery store in Schaumburg Il that served amazing authentic ramen. I have to say we were a bit disappointed with RR. It was just ok for us and based on the reviews I knew it could be hit or miss depending on your experience with true ramen. It wasn't bad however it was not memorable. Like the space it was in, but not a big fan of the ramen. Our search continues.

This is my first taste of Ramen in Arizona and well... The broth wasn't too salty but also wasn't as bold as what I've been  accustomed too back in Southern California. 
The charisu lacked any real flavor and was hidden in behind the taste of the broth.
What threw me off the most was witnessed when I tilted my head up a bit. There was just too much dust up on the AC ducts. Dare I say some spots looked caked with dust, even the fans.. Just imagining all that being blown down into the dinning area almost changed my decision about eating there, but I was too hungry and I had to eat something.
If there's anything I liked, it was the noodles. Firmness was perfect and there was plenty of it.

Honeydew snow was great and so were the gyoza but...........

This is my third time here in 5 years and to call this ramen is simply an injustice to Japanese Culture and Cuisine. Underwhelming noodles, broth that isn't ramen form in anyway, and toppings that ironically remained on the bottom of the bowl throughout the meal - unsavory and untouched. 

It's like if I took a piece of bread, covered it in ketchup, and put a Kraft american single on top and sold it as pizza in Korea. 
(Though knowing Koreans I think its already been done lol)

That said avoid the ramen and this place is actually pretty great! (Cool ambiance and interior as well) Time for a name change?

Good ramen, the noodles are okay, but the broth is always delicious. Lots of add ins, and lots of choices. I get something a little different every time I go. Staff is very nice and helpful, and the prices aren't too bad. Only wish it were closer to me in Phoenix, but when I go to Tempe, I always make a stop here.

I've always come back to this place when I'm craving a big delicious bowl of soup. Today was a perfect day for just that! 
I haven't been since it was last cool out, but it seems as if they are putting more content into the ramen, so it was quite filling and I didn't need the extra noodles.
Tea was fresh and wonderful and my 1st udon noodles was good I don't have anything to campare them to, so my 1st has to be the best! We slurped them down! I'll try ramen next time!

Came here on a date! Food was yummy :) the spicy ramen wasn't quite as spicy as I've had before at other places but it is more americanized so there's that. Otherwise was nice and big portion that keeps you full for the day.

Love the vegetarian bowl!

Wish they had one in North Phoenix...
I do not recommend this restaurant. I ordered pork ramen, and it tasted very salty. If you don't like salty food. This place is not for you. Plus their restroom are very nasty.
Could've used more flavor. The spinach in the broth was too much. Had to add a lot of other spices so it wouldn't taste so bland. Huge serving size for $10

Two of us ate here on Sunday 4/26/15 ... The food was tasty but one of the dirtiest restaurants I've been in for quite some time.
Men's room absolutely nasty ... toilet oveflowing, I told 2 different employees and neither one did anything about it.
Floors were filthy, you can see into the kitchen and it looked no better than the mens room. The filth has obviously been building up for quite some time.
If I had used the restroom or seen the kitchen before we had gotten our food, I would not have ordered.

Noodles where doughy/under cooked. 
Really dislike their egg topping as it was hard boiled and halved. Hard boiled egg would be ok if it where multiple small slices but if you're going to halve it, it had better be soft boiled so it disperses throughout the broth, not just two large dry solid pieces.
For all I know this is not typical quality. I only visited once. But you know what they say... you never get a second chance to make a first impression.. and the most important thing restaurant needs to get right is consistency. It has to be good every time. 
Unfortunately I live in Tucson and am not willing to travel again to have another mediocre experience. So I'll pass on Republic Ramen.
For comparison I find Ikkyu's Tonkatsu ramen on Orange Grove to be better although a bit less extravagant with their toppings. Sachiko Sushi on Valencia also has a better Sukiyaki ramen.
Oh well, the search for truly great Ramen is still on.
Please message me with suggestions for Ramen in AZ, particularly in Tucson.

Always excited for Vegetarian ramen. If I see it, that's where I'm going, no matter what meal it is. Veggie ramen is sometimes hard to come by, especially in Arizona so this place was a surprise find. 

The ramen was good, but not the best I've had. I like Umami more for their veggie ramen. Next time I'm in Mesa, I will probably come back.

Officially found my new favorite boba spot!! So I think i must of picked the perfect time to come in (5:30) because there were only a few people there and it was still nice and quiet so I could get my boba and curl up in a booth waiting for my ramen. I ended up deciding on the Tonkotsu without meat and adding an egg into it. Over all pretty well done, loved the noodles and veggies combo! Although I do recommend getting the spices they have next to the soft drinks because once I added that it added a lot more flavor and spice! Favorite thing was the strawberry slush boba I got!! Perfect texture to the boba!!

This was pretty great. We came down from N. Phoenix just to check it out. The menu is pretty simple and great for the vegetarian in your family. I got the house, Republic Ramen, which was a little spicy but flavorful. The pork was thinly cut and I wish it was in a little smaller pieces. Star's vegetarian looked good. She got the tofu of course but only got 4 slices. The waiter made a point to mention that they were pan seared. She would have liked a few more slices after all the add tofu winds up being $.50 a slice. We walked away spending a little under $25 for two entrees an pp. of edamame and a 1 large Kirin. The broth makes a great second day soup with some buttered bread. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a new experience at a reasonable price.
I ordered the Shio Ramen and it was delicious! Although it was a tad salty for my taste. But it's a great price for the amount you get of soup. Definitely a unique place!

100% bar none my favorite place to eat. I eat here 3 times a week! 

Affordable, Filling, Consistant, And awesome service culture!

I get the Vegetarian Ramen w/ Zuchini every time, it's to the point where before k get to the counter they have my order ready for me, they treat me like family here and I bring everyone I know!

If you have not been here you need to come!

It's been a few months since Republic opened, and there's been A LOT of changes. For one, they addressed my complaints about the separate menus by making it possible to order boba drinks at the ramen counter. They've also changed the way ramen is ordered, and there's more of the veggies/protein than when they started, which was one of my main complaints. 
The menu has also expanded to udon and soba, and there's an extensive sake menu.

Yet the novelty of this place has worn off. 
There's still some elementary problems: The amount of protein/veggies is still not enough compared to the amount of noodles given. Shrimp tempura udon was just 2 pieces of shrimp and 1 onion tempura? I paid $8 for that? Do you realize you can make udon at home for $1, which means you just charged me $3.50 for each fried shrimp? 
The broths are way too salty. I've tried the whole gamut of them, and whenever I leave, I have to run to the nearest water source and drink a gallon of water. A few times I've even experienced the unpleasant film in my mouth left by MSG. I really hope they're not using MSG to flavor the broths, but I'm not sure what other ingredients are capable of leaving that weird aftertaste/film.

And why is it closed on Sundays?!

It was good. Very clean place, with decent service and okay prices. I had the signature Republic Ramen. It was good, but I added some spice to it. My wife and stepson enjoyed theres more than I did mine. Portions are a good size. 

I don't know, I thought it was good, but not great. There is nothing wrong with the place, but I doubt I will come here very often. Give it a try, by all means, but don't expect something spectacular.

I had the tonkatsu ramen with traditional toppings and it was really good! It was very salty though, but it was still great. You get a lot for your money's worth! I also had milk tea with boba, which was as little watered down for my taste, but I've had worse hahaha I'm actually wanting to try their curry rice and see how that tastes!

Been here a few times. I usually order the Curry Rice and add chicken, and the sweet sauce that they give you on the side, however I tried the Ramen last time I went. It is delicious and it definitely fills you up, I've had to carry out everytime I order just because it's a healthy amount for me. Service is pretty good and they have some delicious Boba. Restaurant is clean, has open windows so lots of light. Located in Tempe past the busy side of Mill ave, so it's a cool place to just relax and enjoy some good food. Sake Bombs too! :)

A Deliciously Rare Find! 

I first heard about this place when my classmate Rita mentioned a good ramen place. I came here today with 3 of my classmates (Julie, Angela, and Natalie) and we were definitely pleased with our orders! 

We got:
Ramen Republic
Garlic Chicken 
Boba: Taro, Honey Dew, Black, and Thai

The Ramen Republic was very flavorful! No need to add Siracha! The portions are huge enough that it's easy to split between two people. The Garlic Chicken Ramen was also so tasty! Its not spicy, but you can tell there's a million mouth watering flavors there. 

The boba here redeems my previous thoughts about boba in the area. The balls were freshly made, moist, soft, and the kind that melts in your mouth. The milk tea boba was also well prepared! It didn't have that cheap boba taste that's watered down. It's very rich and just the way I like my boba! 

Alex, the guy that took our orders was very helpful and friendly. We also got nice discount coupons so I will be returning for sure!

If you want a tastey noodle dish, possibly with boba tea to follow, this is a great new option for North Tempe. I've only been there once so far, but intend on making this place a frequent stop. They've upgraded a bit since some of the earlier reviews and you can now order cafe items from the main restaurant's register.

The service was fast and friendly, the noodles were excellent, the portions were generous (though the meat could be a little MORE generous, given the price of the dish), and the honeydew milk tea was refreshing.

During the meal the chef came out and chatted with our table a bit. Sounds like they'll be adding more types of noodle dishes to the menu shortly. If you're a fan of Asian noodles, this place is definitely worth stopping in at.
For Asian that's a place for American, cause the menu is design for them.... But the food still taste good n the place is clean. If u r looking for American style Asian food try here!
Called and was put on hold for 10 minutes. I then called back and it was busy as the woman still hadn't got back to the phone to even realize I had hung up. Nice way to treat your customers.

Great, fast service and a nice clean atmosphere for some pretty cheap prices. I generally get their (fancy and tasty!) iced tea and add the garlic and soy-soaked egg to my soups, which makes things closer to 10 bucks a head.

Not all of the broths are for everyone; I like the tonkatsu broth the most and don't really get the chili-oriented broths, but my wife's reasonably fond of those. The sapporo corn broth is really fun. There are lots of condiments for the soup: the togarashi chili powder's generally enough for me, but if you'd like your soup saltier/sesame-er, go for it.

The curry rice is surprisingly excellent, too! It's really hard to justify gettin' that when you're at a ramen house, though.

There's better ramen in the valley, but not with this price or the fun amount of options. The veggies are unique and fresh, and everyone's super friendly. It's a great place to warm your bones when it's cold or rainy outside.

Pro tip: eat most of the spinach before it cooks in your soup if you don't want it to alter your noodles' flavor.

Go to spot beside hotel for week...quick service.. great ramen bowls.. many to choose from.. enjoyed with beef.. liked traditional side...kimchi was delicious not spicy... only complaint was the young college men "working" there. On phones.. not getting orders right... seemed just lazy.. and no thank you.  All the ladies were very attentive and on their game..

I am an avid ramen noodle lover. The options were fantastic. I ordered the Chili Pepper Ramen "traditional style" and added an egg and off the menu spicy. Very few restaurants are willing to really make a dish spicy. I typically order this way at Thai restaurants and only 1 out of 5 of my favorite places has produced a dish that needed no extra spice. Republic ramen came through in the spice department. The tofu was not too squishy or soggy - just right and the veggies were not over cooked.  My bf had the Shoyu Ramen - original style - great flavor - no extra spice. We also had the seaweed salad which was also one of the best we've had. The seaweed flavor was not too strong. Finally, we had boba tea's - traditional black tea flavor. They were good, the flavor/consistency was not the best we've had - seemed a bit watered down, but would probably still stop by and grab one if we were in the area.

OMG. Am I glad to have found this place. I absolutely loved the dish that I had. Pork, with ramen and all the vegetables in a pork broth. Truly tastey. This is not a fancy place. Some of the best finds aren't and this was one of them. I'm definitely going back. I do suggest eating there. It's always the experience and the food.

Yahhhh my first time eating ramen = much success, yes!

It'd been on my to-eat list for quite some time since I live within biking distance of the place. It took a good workout though at nearby Phoenix Rock Gym with friends to actually stop and enjoy a fat bowl of ramen afterwards. 
Beware if you want to add anything in addition to what is included in the bowl already - it can end up costing you a pretty penny for lots of extras! 

Our group made quite a line upon arrival which in turn made our bowls take a bit of time to be delivered [oh well]. I went with my friend's suggestion of Tonkotsu Bowl with pork. Many great flavors, but just it seems not a lot of fixins, waaaay too many noodles in the bowl with the soup to be worthy of the cost. Loved the edamame, because you can't go wrong with edamame. Delicious ramen though and I'd probably return to split a bowl + edamame and some boba next time.

This is the second time visiting here and I really like there noodles and for the price you can't go wrong!! It also helps that are two kids are still small enough that we can share a bowl with them and everyone is full. Our first visit we had the Tonkastu Ramen with pork and tofu. However on our second we had the Sapporo ramen and vegetable ramen with chicken and tofu, along with edamame and gyoza. Well definitely be back on our next visit to Az.My only reason for giving a 4 star is because our 2nd visit the customer service was terrible!!! I felt like I was bothering the kids behind the counter with my order. Then when our food arrived it was just placed on the table and that was it. Now on our 1st visit the gentleman was a little bit older but was definitely more energetic and sociable!! He was the one who brought out our food and even came back to check on us and how we liked the noodles. Despite the second visit being very lack luster I will be back because we liked the food and the price.

I'm trying to get a more broad spectrum of reviews up because as of now I've been mostly reviewing my mainstays and places I'm obsessed with so here goes. This place is totally decent. I had their special ramen with beef and it wasn't bad at all. The broth was spicy but good and on a cold night when I was craving soup it  hit the spot. The reason that this place is just 3 stars and I probably won't be returning except for rare occasions is because it really was just ramen. You get a few slices of beef (and there are a few other options) on top but it really wasn't enough in my opinion to justify  the price and also, getting so much broth you would expect a little more beef than you get. Really, its ramen... I could go buy 90 packs in the store for $9 so if I'm going to pay that for one serving please throw in a little more meat.  I do feel like eating in here might be a little better since they give you a huge bowl and the presentation is a little better than taking it home (broth in one bowl, noodles in another, beef on top of noodles cold). I could possibly come back but it would probably be a similar situation as the last time, cold night and in the mood for ramen.
It's salty and good.  Simple menu without a ton of deviation so you don't have much chance of ordering something they're bad at.

Stale vibe / decor , bland food ... Either this place is supes terrible or Clever Koi is seven stars on a five star scale. The "egg" was a stained brown color and the yoke was hard boiled , not soft. I actually thought there were sliced mushrooms in my ramen .. Alas, 'twas merely the rubbery brown sliced egg.

The noodles were the best and ginger honey green tea nice a sweetened to perfection. A great place to go on those nights you don't feel like cooking and a good healthy serving filled w fresh veggies. A kid friendly place too

Scarfed down all my food before I remembered to take a picture!!

I was so excited to see they have Boba here, & Snow Boba at that!! So I got a large mango snow-- absolutely delicious!!

My fiance & I got the Sapporo ramen, I got traditional toppings & he got the original. I actually think the concept is clever, picking your toppings-- like someone else had said, similar to Chipotle but a ramen joint...

You have to know what tastes mesh well together though, & because of the Chipotle-esque atmosphere-- unless you know what your doing, I don't think you should expect a ton of recommendations.

Food came out quickly, as to be expected in this type of atmosphere, & the portion was a good size.

This place was recommended by a friend & I do have to say, it exceeded my expectations. Will be going back, especially for Snow Boba! :)

Love this place since it's close to ASU campus! The noodles in the ramen they use are so good. I tried their SNO for the first time-- I got taro sno with condensed milk, mini Mochi, and coconut flakes. It was SO good. Definitely try this place out

A foreword to this review- everyone PLEASE visit Republic Ramen for my own selfish purposes.  I've been waiting forever for quality boba somewhere near me and a legit ramen place.  This is it.  Support them :-)

MENU
Noodles:
The complaint from serious Ramen lovers here is that the menu might be a little limited.  However, it's Arizona, they're doing what they do right, and well, it's Arizona.  With the different varieties of add-ins and their spice/sauce selection, you can pretty much have any kind of delicious ramen you want.   They have 6 standard types of broth and 9 add-ins to mix it up.  They also have 3 combo options with edamame, gyoza, and curry rice.  
Boba: In case you haven't heard, the restaurant is split into a tea care and a noodle house.  The tea cafe has a great selection of boba flavors, tea varieties and a good solid tapica pearl (not overly sweet).  Props to the Taro- it's my favorite I've had so far which includes Chinatowns in New York, San Francisco and Seattle. They also have Snows (basically an awesome slushy) and regular teas.  

DRINKS:
See above for the boba.  The owner said they're trying to get a liquor license and he envisions an alcoholic boba menu in the future. Whaaaat?  Best idea ever.  But, as of now, no booze.  

VALUE: (hey, look! new cateogry to my reviews!)
The ramen is priced exactly how it should be, so long as you save the double helping for the next meal.  Don't throw it!  It's completely comparable to Ramen in bigger cities.  

CLEANLINESS/OVERALL QUALITY
Brand new, spotless.  Great modern design and classy casual feel.  

SERVICE
They were a bit slow for what I ordered in the tea shop but the ramen comes out really quickly.  You can also order ahead for easy takeout.  I've only eaten in-house once so my service knowledge is limited.  Their takeout is 100% dependable, however.  

ATMOSPHERE
Urban casual without compromising atmosphere.  I would even take a date here- quick and funky, full of character, nice people, and definitely empty since this place is new and has trouble keeping a crowd (Again, please support- they're great!)

This was my first time having ramen other than occasionally tasting other people's when I was out with family in the past. I also had some of the gyoza, seaweed salad, sno and boba. The ramen and the seaweed salad were both good as was the sno, though I doubt I would go out of my way to order it again. The boba was just bad and the gyoza was so salty you couldn't really taste anything else. The couple of people we dealt with at the counter were nice and answered all our questions. I would definitely go back for the ramen but I'd probably stick with just that.

We're lucky to have Republic R+N in the Valley, let alone Tempe. It's an amazing ramen cafe - with six different broths and a dozen different add-ins from which to choose. Plus they just expanded the menu to include other classic fast Japanese favorites - curry, udon combos, etc. The space is beautiful, and the employees - every last one of them - are so friendly and helpful and accommodating. This is such a five star place!!!!

Minor quibbles - extra spicy broth is almost indistinguishable from normal broth, and the curry is not traditional Japanese curry. It's OK, but not what you'd expect. Major quibble - what they charge for protein is simply outrageous. A few sprinklings of chicken, a few slices of pork or beef, a few cubes of tofu = two dollars added on??? An already pricey $7 bowl becomes a $10 bowl including tax because a (very) little protein is added? Unless this is Kobe beef, this is outrageous. Penny wise and pound foolish guys - triple the protein you serve or cut its price in half. The current pricing is crazy.

C'mon guys - you're so five stars, just fix the protein problem! In the meantime, dear reader, this is still a place to relish at any price.

Best ramen I've ever had in Arizona! I normally get the pork broth with chicken & veggies ramen, it's my favorite. I live in Glendale and it's about 30-40min from home at least and it's worth the drive.

I'm not a fair judge of Republic Ramen. 

I have had amazing ramen too many times now and when I go to a shop specializing in ramen, if it's not pretty great, then I can't help but hate it. They have "tonkotsu ramen" on the menu too so that alone sets expectations.

I ordered the "tonkotsu ramen" and hated it. Broth was weak with no depth of flavor. Noodles had no chew. As much as I hoped to love it, I was completely let down.

To be fair, I don't believe there is any decent tonkotsu ramen in Arizona. 

I just don't see why this shouldn't be a concept that can be executed adequately here. For me, with the ramen I've had and love, it definitely wasn't.

Again, I'm not a fair judge of ramen. I'm mean and nasty about it. It's like sushi or uni. Once you elevate your expectations by having the stellar stuff, the mediocre doesn't cut it anymore. 

And where I can eat American style sushi when I adjust my expectations (happy for crunch rolls and California rolls), can't do it for ramen.

If you're not passionate about ramen though, it's fine to ignore me. If you don't have amazing authentic ramen to hold it up to, it's probably fine.

Great soup at a great price! The noodles are delicious- we came with an international student from Japan and our 3 elementary-aged girls, and they all loved it. A very family-friendly atmosphere and laid-back, you order when you come in and they bring the soup out. We definitely plan to come again!

Not quite as good as Tohzan, but a solid second choice.  Phx has really been lacking a decent ramen house and this fills the void in the Tempe area. 

I had the shoyu ramen which was excellent and reminded me of the more traditional style I'm used to, but my partner had the Republic ramen which was spicy, delicious and of Korean inffluence. We also had the gyoza which were OK, but I thought they would be better. Next time I would opt out of those and maybe try a different side. There were also kim-chi, fried rice and edamame as other options for sides as well as other toppings for the ramen.

I was very pleased with my first visit and can't wait to go again. I do hope they expand and branch out the menu to some other ramen styles and maybe so other sides. 

Excellent ramen and good work Republic!

I am happy to hear that a ramen noodle place opened in valley.  I love eating ramen noodles when I was in Cali.  At first driving into the plaza, it bring back the days when I attended ASU.  This location used to be billiard place. It was definitely a college hangout, still is.  The space of the restaurant is huge.  They divided portion of the restaurant with a Boba bar.  I thought it was pretty neat.  I didn't try the Boba drink, but my friend did.  I can't remember what she had, but the drink was too watery and too sweet, according to her.  The menu selection is small.  I had ordered their house ramen, Republic Ramen.  It was supposed to be mild, but of course it came out with a kick.  You get two or three charsiu porks, so call veggies (lot of scallions) lack of spinach, and sprouts.  I think they forgot to put in the sprouts.   The soup base was spicy.  That was it!  The soup was very bland.  Was it worth the $6.95 for a bowl of ramen?  Not really!  Would I go back? Yeah probably so, the restaurant can fit a large crowd; friendly staffs, and good mid location (Tempe).

This was on a list of restaurants I had to try for Check, Please AZ. I went with a friend and we ordered the pork ramen and had the spicier version. It came with veggies but the protein was a little underwhelming, not the tender pork belly which I am used to but tougher meat like in pho. We also split the seaweed salad. My friend really liked their marigold tea. The place is very college-y and had a cafeteria feel. Next time will try the boba/cafe area. It's alright, not the worst place for asian food but definitely not the best. I believe the draw here is cheap, decent food.

Well, despite having (ugh) tapioca (ugh) that they stick in tea, the Republic is a pretty awesome place.  Now my wife tells me that this is different than Pho but I don't really see how.  It's a bowl of scalding hot soup full of noodles and meat.  Anyways, this stuff is really tasty.  Way better than the cup of noodles you lived off in college.

I tried the Republic which was apparently the spicy one.  It was decently spicy but I still added some of that magic red sauce.  It came with a side of edemame which had been steamed and lightly salted. The workers were all friendly and helpful.  The interior was very nice and made me feel quite welcome.

My only complaint was the price.  I feel like $8 for a bowl of noodles is asking a lot.  Especially in Tempe.

This is my new favorite place!  You will love their ramen. My favorite is the Republic Ramen which is spicy but addicting as well. The Miso Ramen is great  if you don't like spicy and the Tonkotsu Ramen is delicious if you like a more sweet milky flavored broth. You can add whatever vegetables and extras you want to. The gyoza is great but I prefer mine steamed and they are able to accommodate that if you request it. The staff couldn't be more friendly. The service is fast. Don't miss out on the Boba tea. I get the Thai milk tea with boba, it is perfect. I am so happy this place exists.

This was my first time eating ramen, turns out soba noodles are not ramen, however, it was still bomb and I really enjoyed the food! It was a lot of food for a good price. Not too salty, fresh spinach with scallions SO GOOD!  I recommend it. I thought the atmosphere was really cool in the evening. I would recommend it for a night out with friends or a first date. Ladies, no lipstick because it will all come off via noodle action haha.

Udon here is absolutely delicious!! My favorite place to go when I want something more light and healthy.

However, the facility and service are a big disappointment every time I come in. The past few times I walked through the door there was a line about 5-10 people deep and no one running the front counter. 10 minutes goes by and still no one... Finally one of the back of house staff pokes their head around the corner and yells for someone to come up from the back to take orders. Unacceptable in my opinion.

At night this place is very dark and dingy feeling. Oh and bring your own spoons since they never seem to have any!!

After hearing about this from my friends, I was super excited to visit here. 

It's not a sit down restaurant, you walk in and there's a counter right in front of you with a decent-sized menu displayed from behind. Be sure to know your Japanese cuisine terms or you'll have no idea what the noodle toppings are. 

I ordered Tokyo Ramen, which was "light and spicy" and had it with beef and the Traditional Toppings. There was one person ahead of me, but our food came out at the same time, it took about ten minutes (not too bad). I wasn't thoroughly impressed, but I finished half of it - the bowl is HUGE by the way. I wouldn't get the beef because if you let it sit in the hot broth, it'll eventually get tougher, but its flavor seeps into the soup. I did have to add some Sriracha sauce to give it an extra kick.

Other than the food, there is also a variety of boba milk tea. I ordered the Thai milk tea, and it was great!

Overall, my experience could have been better, but it wasn't awful. I'll definitely come back sometime and have to try the udon.
It took a few visits to find the ramen I liked best, but they are all good. Very sizable portions, and quick service. Employees are very friendly and I enjoy making regular trips.

Not too pricey way to get a huge meal. I had the tonkotsu noodles and it was a little too salty, but otherwise, the meat was generous and the toppings fresh. One bowl could have easily fed two people, so I definitely had some leftovers!

I've been here about three times. I was in the mood for soup the other day, and I decided I'd stop by Republic since it's so class to ASU. I'd only ever gotten the shoyu ramen which literally just tastes like soy sauce. This time I decided to go with miso ramen with tofu and original toppings. I asked if I could get another vegetable or more carrots in place of sprouts because I do not like sprouts, and the cashier simply refused both requests. I'm not paying for an extra vegetable after you take one out. How hard is it to put more carrots and not put in any sprouts. It's not as thought the veggies are cooked into the soup. Well I decided I didn't want to spend more on this soup than necessary, so I chose to forego paying extra for the egg. I got my soup shortly after, and I wan't completely satisfied. It has so little veggies in it, and guess what?! There were a little bit of sprouts in it. I pick out as much as I could find and put it on the table, and I ended up crunching on a few I didn't find before. How hard was it to put one ingredient less? Completely refused to give me what I asked for. I'm not in the business of giving my money to places that don't service me to satisfaction, so since that cashier wanted to make a stink about a veggie substitution, I'll find some place else to get my ramen next time.
The ramen here was good! I had the miso ramen "original" style, very tasty! And they also have a variety of beers, sake, and soju which was a big plus! Def recommend

It used to be this was a five star place to eat for me, it just seems I had not reviewed yet. Well, this is my review now. This place is no longer as great as it used to be sadly. Here's my reasoning as to why.

Yesterday we went to eat there in a large group of seven, this has never been an issue and wasn't last night. The issue began when I ordered Miso Ramen to be vegan, something that I have done for the past 2 years that we have been going to this place. Apparently now they put pork in the base, something I was just informed of last night. In addition, it seems that they put pork in all but the vegetarian and Shiso ramen. This was very disappointing not only to me, my family who also has vegetarian members, but also those in my group who cannot eat pork for religious purposes. Their udon dishes all have fish sauce, but that is nothing new. 

The girl taking our order was kind enough to inform us of this, but ended up getting more and more irritated as we were trying to figure out what we could eat and what we wanted to do. We figured out what we could eat, ordered and sat down to wait. The food came and all was going well until my sister, one of the groups vegetarians, discovered meat in her food. She returned the bowl and explained why she needed a new one made. 

The one who made the second bowl was a waitress that I have seen there for the past two years I have been going. She's a little below average height, dark hair, wears glasses and I believe her name is Karina. She's great. Always friendly with amazing customer service. She made up the second bowl and the rest of the night went smooth. That was until the waitress that took our order decided to complain about us, very visibly pointing at our table while she spoke. This girl would not give us her name, but she was short and the few times I have seen her she has worn a messy bun for her hair. She also has a poor attitude it seems. Pity.

Suffice to say we will not be returning after being long time regulars. It is a shame because we really did like this place. Unfortunately we do not appreciate poor customer service and getting sick off of the food because of "the necessity of pork/meat for flavor". I thank all the other waiters and waitresses who have been amazing to us over our time eating there. We will no longer be returning, but we hope that they will once more become a happier, more vegetarian friendly place again.

This is my second time eating here and I was not disappointed! I got the tonkatsu ramen with original toppings, spam, and added tofu as well. I think the broth tasted even better this time than the first time! I brought my friend here and she had the same ramen but with chicken, and she couldn't stop saying how good it is and so yummy! She did say the chicken could have tasted better, but republic ramen satisfied her noodle soup craving! 

I also got a thai tea with boba and it was soooo good. I will definitely be back again, no complaints! And to make it even better, the portion was so big I get to have a second serving later!!!

Wow!  So good.  I came here with Sarah A (aka Dr Sarah) to give it a try before it got too hot out eat soup and I loved it.  I got a simple traditional ramen bowl with tofu and ate up every last drop.  I understand its not authentic ramen but that's fine by me because it still tastes great.  After all, Taco Bell isn't authentic Mexican food and I like them too.  

I'm looking forward to fall just so I can come here and enjoy some more ramen.

I encountered this place when I went to the Phoenix Rock Gym and was excited to try it! I moved here from California not too long ago and was missing the delicious ramen places back home. I got the Republic Ramen and a black milk tea with boba. The people who work there are excellent! Great service, quick, and really friendly. The style is kinda modern with a cool hang out vibe. (not sure if that is a thing but I'm making it one :))

The republic ramen was tasty. It is a little spicy. Comes with 5 or 6 slices of the meat of your choice, fresh spinach, and fresh bean sprouts. I thought the flavor was decent but missing a little something savory about it, but still overall good. I might be a little skewed because I haven't had ramen for a while and was craving it. But, I would definitely go back.

The boba was the highlight for me. The tapioca balls were a perfect balance of chew not old and hard like most of the places around here. The milk tea was a perfect amount of sweet unlike other bobas that make me feel like one sip and I'll go into instant diabetic shock. 

Overall I love this place!
I love this place.  The Ramen is good,  the service is fast,  the prices are reasonable.  Need I say more?

Nooodle Soup! Growing up, noodle soup was a staple in my family. From the 15 cent ramen packages, to the upgraded ramen/pho/vermicelli packages you would get at the Asian supermarket, to the real deal: Noodles made from scratch that my Nai Nai (grandma) would make.

Republic Ramen + Noodles really brought that soothing comfort food feel back, but without the guilt of prepackaged, processed, fried ramen. Nope these noodles are made fresh daily (or so the cashier told me with much enthusiasm when I asked him if the noodles were fried like the notorius 15 cent packages). Fresh ingredients of spinach, sprouts, and cute little petal shaped carrots to garnish your hot, steamy bowl. 

The steps are simple: choose your broth, choose your protein, choose your add ins like egg, kimchi, or tofu. This place to me was genius. Noodle soup heaven and healthy to boot.

My favorite was the Tonkotsu ramen. I also tried the Shiro as well, but it was a bit too salty for my taste.

This place was right next door to the condo I rented out for Ironman Arizona. I enjoyed it so much I visited 3 times. Twice for noodle soup and once for the bubble tea. The snow drinks were a fantastic post race reward drink ( I had been eyeing them the week leading to the race). They were as good as I had imagined if not better.

Thanks RR for fueling me up with noodle soup goodness pre and post race!

It was a rainy Saturday in the streets of Tempe that my husband and I decided a bowl of hot ramen will cheer us up.
I ordered the Udon bowl of soups with tofu.
It was good, but not my favorite.i really wanted to love his place because it's close to home, but unfortunately, it didn't hit a home run with me.

I love this place great ramen my favorite is the republic it's a little spicy but that's what I like about it. It's not to hot or spicy just right. The other ramen are pretty good too!
The environment is really relaxing not to loud or crowded.
I always crave this place and always coming back

There was a bowl. It had noodles in it. Neither my wife nor I enjoyed said bowl. She did miso ramen with pork, I did the same with beef. Tasted like roast beef boiled in soup. Yum? Place was clean and people were friendly. Most people seemed to enjoy their bowls, so maybe it was just us. We had ramen in Okinawa, so maybe we were expecting too much.

The most awful ramen imaginable! Smelled like a dirty rug...And.. 40 min wait at the table! 
Such a change from 5 years ago! To bad.
They have wonderful food but the noodles come in huge portions, bring your appetites with you

Good ramen is hard to come by in Phoenix. I heard about this place from one of my coworkers and thought I'd give it a try. I ordered the Republic Ramen, which was pretty decent. Spicy and plenty of stuff in it. The workers were super friendly and I'm excited to try something new next time. I recommend if you like ramen.

The Best Sopporo Ramen in the Valley. Our place for a true ramen fix. The food is always good ns the service is fast. Don't live in the area but always make the drive for great ramen. Almost forgot they have sake and good boba drinks.

Um... Yum! This place was surprisingly good. I have had ramen (real ramen) one other time in Seattle, and I thought it was alright, but this was really good! I got the shio broth, which was good, kind of a standard clear broth, and I added garlic and got chicken in it. The guy at the counter was super helpful, and he helped me pick out what to put in the soup... he didn't even seem (that) annoyed by all of my questions either, so that was nice. I really liked the way they garnished the soup, it had spinach, carrot, sprouts, and green onions. It looked really colorful and added some dimension to the soup. I added some of their spicy seasoning stuff and it was good. The noodles were really tasty, they were just the right texture for ramen, a little chewy. Gotta like that! Also, the chicken surprised me in how good it was! It looked not so great in the bowl, but when I tried it, it was so tender... like infused with the broth and melting in my mouth.... so good. The portion size is huge, I couldn't finish it. I will definitely come back here... if it was good in the summer, I can only imagine it will be great in the winter!

My co worker talks about this place all the time so we came here for lunch. 

It wasn't too busy during the day. I didn't think the customer service was that great. The girl that rang me up seemed like she didn't really want to be there. No smile or anything. I ordered the tonkatsu ramen with spam and added corn. I also had a taro milk tea with boba. I thought the ramen noodles and broth were good. The downfall for me was I felt like there wasn't a lot of toppings offered. Most places the ramen will come with an egg and some sort of pork. But those were both extra. I'm also used to ordering some sort of krackling or pork belly which they also didn't have. So I felt there wasn't a lot of variety when it came to that. 

The price is reasonable and it's a good portion but I wouldn't say it's the best ramen in town.

I had a craving for ramen noodles, and so I ended up finding this place through Yelp.
My friend and I ordered a Shio ramen bowl with traditional toppings with beef and a shrimp tempura udon bowl with traditional toppings.
My criticism lies primarily with the overall taste of the broths, the beef I got with the shio ramen bowl and the noddles (ramen and udon) in both bowls. 
-The beef was bland with no flavor and tasted like it had been reheated. 
-The noddles in both bowls were still aldente/ slightly hard, and not in a good way. It tasted like both of the noddles were previously frozen and only got 3/4's of the way cooked. 
-The taste of each broth was overall lacking. If you are reading this and you've have Japanese ramen before and/or you have had any asian packet-ramen at home, you know that the noddles should have a deep flavor to them (either from a broth based in pork, beef, chicken, soy sauce, dashi etc and/or msg/ salt etc), and these...did not have any of that.
Overall, my impression from walking out of the place was that I should have spent my money going somewhere else.

Positives:
The portion sizes were good, although again, not worth much in terms of taste.
The environment is cool and inviting.

It's was good can't complain. If your craving ramen it's a good place to go. The place is clean and we got our food right away. The ramen was good not the best I I've had but it was close to it. Will definitely be returning

This was a really awesome ramen noodle restaurant. I wasn't expecting such a huge bowl! The chili pepper ramen was super good and spicy. I also had a side of the shrimp tempura which was also very tasty. I would recommend picking that up with your ramen bowl.

Excellent Tokyo Ramen! Fresh ingredients and killer broth. I am so glad to h e found a good ramen place in Phoenix. Now I just need them to open one up on the west side. 
I can't wait to bring the wife!

Came in for an early dinner with my siblings and my boyfriend. It was a nice little restaurant, you order your food and they bring it to your table. The ramen was okay, I'll have to say I've had better with more options. 

But then I remember this is Arizona and we have pretty much nothing when it comes to food like this.
