The guy who took my order was really friendly and very enthusiastic when it came to answering our questions. The only thing missing was screaming "Irrashaimase!" when people walked in. Lol. I had ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen and like others have said, the broth was pretty weaksauce when I compared it to Cherryblossom. It felt lacking, but it still had flavor. For some people it might be a little salty but I can see why there are lots of veggies in the soup, balances the flavor out.

My boyfriend had the Republic and he said it was pretty spicy, but his soup was a little lackluster for his tastes. 
My little brother and sister enjoyed their tonkatsu meals but didn't like the mass of vegetables in their way of noodle paradise. Haha.
All in all it was a nice experience. Quite a drive for some ramen though. We didn't wait too long for our boba drinks either. Probably because it wasn't that busy. 

I will be returning. :)

Very good! We had the Sapporo Ramen and it was very good! They give large portions and its cheap. Their broth is stunning. Next time I would try a different ramen just to get an idea of their different broths but I feel the Sapporo would be my go to! I highly recommend this place.

I have driven by this place so many times and always wanted to try it. I decided since I had the day off I would try it for lunch. I ordered the republic ramen with traditional toppings and pork. I also had an ice tea. The ice tea was ok I have had better but was still nice. It wasn't very busy nice crowd for a Friday at 2pm. The staff was very helpful in asking questions and making recommendations. One thing to note that it has been very cold in the area and so the restaurant was also very chilly food came out fairly quickly and looked amazing.  Here is the kicker it tasted amazing just the right amount of heat great ramen cooked perfectly. It was exactly what I was looking for. I will definitely be back and like to try their different offerings.

Four of us had Shoyu ramen,  Tonkotsu ramen, Udon and Shrimp Udon. The broth was all very good but on the strong side. Ive had better, but many worse in Tokyo.  I give their food 4 stars. Cleanliness is at 2 stars. Young workers tend not to care about that, i guess.  Ambience - perfect for college kids.

PROS: Cashier was helpful and friendly, service was good, decent boba selection.
CONS: Place is dirty, both ramen & udon taste packaged with some fresh green onions and spinach thrown in for color, green tea tasted like potpourri.  

Will be on the lookout for a more authentic ramen house with better tasting soup for your money.
Food was great and really inexpensive! Pretty close to authentic.

Perhaps I expected too much of "real" ramen. Perhaps this place does not have said "real" ramen. Or perhaps I just got the wrong flavor, or I'm uncultured in the field of Japanese noodles. Maybe one of these reasons, but from what I tried, I am not a fan.

I either got Shoyu or Shio Ramen, traditional style.

This is a fun place.  It is a great place for a fast, cheap meal.  Is it truly authentic?  It is probably closer to being authentic to many places around the country. Wagamama-like?  Perhaps.  If you know how to order you will do okay here.  A great addition to restaurants in Tempe!

I come here all the time, I get the Tonkotsu ramen with extra noodles.  The people are friendly, the service is outstanding and the ramen is delicious. I like how they let you add as much spice as you like (I like it VERY spicy).  The whole place has a cool vibe to it--I think since its so close to the university.   Keep in mind I've never been to Japan, also I've never had Las Vegas or Hawaiian ramen, but I really like the dish here.

Go here!  Its one of the few places that I recommend to my friends consistently (other places being Oregano's, Cartel Coffee, 4 Peaks, etc.)

This is the best Ramen in Phoenix? Next time I'm in town, I'll should stick to burgers, beer, and good 'ol typical American food.

It's my first trip to Phoenix and I don't know where to eat. After running the Rock & Roll half-marathon, I'm driving around STARVING. Looking to somewhere to eat, I pass by Republic Ramen and I think "Ramen! My favorite!" And decide to stop in. 

Inside, it's set up like a fast food joint: counter, register, and the menu posted high up behind the cashier. After ordering they bring it out to your table. 

My bowl of today, and the last one ever here, is the Sapporo bowl - butter corn in Miso soup. It arrived and I think, "Where's the corn?" - It was sitting at the bottom of the bowl. Presentation is not a priority here. 

My choice of meat was the chicken (which was also hiding) and I went with extra beef. I should've gotten neither. Both were flavorless, I'd even say that they were dry, even after soaking in the broth!

In the end, I've realized there is nothing special about this place but the fact that it must be the town's only ramen to have won that award. 

Call me biased or spoiled, because I come from Los Angeles and we have the BEST ramen: full of amazing flavor and comfortable traditional environments. If you're ever in LA and you crave ramen, add me and scroll through my bookmarks. 

I wouldve given this place a 1, but the people are nice and they show football on the tvs.

The location is great, just right off of ASU's campus. I ordered the Shoyu Ramen with beef and the traditional toppings. The food here is okay, nothing too amazing, but also not that bad.  The menu includes different styled broths, but I wish they had more variety in their menu. Prices are decent for the quality of food that you end up getting. I brought a friend here, and she also ordered the Shoyu Ramen, but they forgot to include her protein! 

Overall, this is a great place to introduce you and your friends to ramen. The service here is fast and friendly, so it's a great lunch stop if you are needing a quick bite and craving some soup and noodles.

Went here for lunch on a Sunday and I was pleased with the food. I didn't feel that the broth was watered down or lacked flavor and thought it was very good. I ordered the vegetarian with rice noodles as it's the only way to make it vegan. The regular ramen noodles have egg in them, which is sad but to be expected. The rice noodles didn't have much flavor, but again, that's to be expected. The portions here are rather large, which is nice...makes you feel like you're getting a good bang for your buck. My soup came loaded with bean sprouts, spinach, red cabbage, carrots, and tofu. I added some chili oil and some ground chili pepper they have in a little shaker, which gave it a really good flavor, not too salty, which I was afraid of. 

The staff was very nice and helpful...I wish I got the girls name who helped us...but she was awesome! 

The only thing that kind of turned me off about this place was the amount of dust. Looking around I could see about three inches of dust on the fans and on the air vents above. The ceiling is painted black as are the fans, which shows every speck of dust...they really need to bust out a vacuum and take care of that because it's a bit off putting. I know previous reviews have commented about this yet it appears to go unchanged. I would also recommend upgrading the iced tea to be in stainless steel dispensers as the plastic we through ones discolor after awhile and start to look dirty even if they're not. 

I hope they take my comments about the dust seriously because I want to go back here.

The restaurant offers a wide variety of Asian noodle dishes, including udon.  The decor is warm with clean lines.  The food was really good and delivered relatively quickly.  The process  to get the food feels more like a fast food restaurant with ordering done at a counter and the food brought out by a waitstaff with very little follow up once the food is delivered.  It took me a while to flag down someone to get me a "to go" bowl when we were ready to leave.  It is definitely a more delicious and healthier option of fast food than the traditional variety.  I will come back next time I am in the neighborhood.

Just went to Republic Ramen a few weeks ago and again Saturday, everyone had been raving over the boba and ramen.  It was delicious. Since my friend told me they had added a vegetarian ramen, so  I was excited to go back and had to try it. 
Impressions; Loved the modern decor, felt very urban. The staff was also nice and helpful. Eager to share about the different flavors! 
The Ramen was wonderful. There was a nice amount of vegetables and a lot of tofu. The flavor of the broth was amazing. The noodles were cooked just the way I like them. The boba was fresh and I tried 2 different flavors. I had one with espresso that came recommended by the boba barista for the caffeine kick I needed, it was full of flavors as he said! I truly enjoyed it all and I will definitely be back soon.

Noodle was cook to perfection but the broth was way too blend. Meaning, salty & not flavored with any ramen broth I've ever had. Too much water added to broth. Spam was cut too thin. I think it would have been bettet if less slices & chunks/cube spam was added.
It's so dark, I couldn't really see what I'm eating or what's in it.
4 pieces of Gyoza way way over priced.

I didn't think I would like this place, because I had the idea in my head that paying for ramen at a restaurant was a waste of money. I mean, you can buy a packet of ramen for $0.25 and make it yourself at home and add your own fixings!  BUT I was wrong. it was totally worth it to pay for the ramen here. I loved their "traditional" toppings choice, very different than other noodle soups I've tried.  and they give you a LOT of food in one bowl - could easily take home  half for leftovers.

plus, the boba is good and tastes like it was made fresh that day, not hard and old like at some other places.  I'd come here again!

The ramen is very good here plus you can't beat the price!! I wound up with 3 meals with just one bowl! I did like the flavors but I've had more developed broths before. I absolutely adored the ice tea selections. Service was great, I was by myself but one of the employees was kind enough to bring me a to go container without seeking like it was any inconvenience even though it was a very busy Saturday and there were tables waiting to be cleaned. I can't wait to go again!

Mmm, ramen!  The ramen here seems like a healthier fresher version of the stuff you can get in Little Tokyo, Los Angeles, CA!  I wonder if the owner is from California...

Anyways, the ramen here is quite decent!  It has a chewy texture and the broth is full of flavor.  The variety of vegetables makes me feel like I ate something healthy versus eating something super heavy.  I had the miso ramen with spam and gyoza combination and it was amazing.  The gyoza was a dumpling of flavor.

While there's better ramen places out there, I'd probably be back for ramen!

When I want a big bowl of comfort food and am in the east valley this is one of our favorites. The soups are great. And I don't have to do any work (I'm the cook in our house). Sometimes I just want a hearty bowl of pho or another Asian soup. And this place can kill that craving. And the prices are high but the portions are huge. I do think that some of the side dishes are a bit expensive for the portion size but the soups are great.

I absolutely love the food here. I've never tasted anything I don't 100% love. The Tokyo ramen with beef is my go to, but the Shoyu and Tonkotsu ramens are delicious as well. The location is great, and the hours aren't bad. I do kind of wish they were open a bit later, I think they'd do well with all the college kids in town!  My only downside to this place is the service. For the most part, you encounter rude, blank staring college kids who are counting down the minutes until their shifts are over. I've never had the pleasure of being greeted by someone friendly! I return for the food, but the service needs a serious improvement.

I was quite skeptical of Republic Ramen at first--not because of how it looked, smelled, or what I had heard but because why would there be a restaurant charging 8 dollars for what I can make for .14 cents?

Man was I wrong. My friends invited me and when I showed up I was happily surprised by the very clean restaurant. Couples sat in the back eating and drinking sake. The lady at the counter was very friendly and when I asked for an explanation of the menu she was very helpful. 

The menu works something like this: pick your broth (they have 5 or 6), then pick the meat. The vegetables are standard but they do have some extras including kimchi!

And the kimchi was amazing, the perfect amount of spice. And it tasted great when put into the ramen. 

The goyza and tempura were amazing and after finishing them I only wanted more. I got their standard ramen with chicken and while the chicken was a tad dry (overcooked) the taste of the broth and the freshness of the vegetables more then made up for it.

Though I've only been once I plan on going again, to try some of their other broths.

Okay time for me to explain. 
I thought the veggie broth would be flavorful but it was rather bland, I was hoping it wouldn't be too salty and it wasn't but it also was lacklusting in much of the wonderful richeness that veggies can offer to a broth, and I found myself trying to just eat the noodles. Which seemed a little over cooked. But it's a decent price so I guess you get what you pay for, I definitely recommend Umami over Republic, Umami's broth packs a flavorful punch! I tried to like this place I really did, you can see into their kitchen and it looks grimy and dirty and that's always a giant indicator as to how much effort a chef puts into his/food.

Satisfied My Ramen Craving!

I have been wanting to find a good bowl of Miso Ramen, and had checked out a few places that I didn't find satisfying. Republic Ramen is not in my neighborhood, but I decided to take the drive to check it out.

First of all, parking was plentiful, and I found a spot with some shade, which is important when it's 109 degrees out. Walking in, there wasn't much in the way of atmosphere, but they had exactly what I wanted on their menu - Original Miso Ramen, which I ordered as is with pork, bean sprouts, carrots, scallions and spinach. You can order additional ingredients, but I wanted to try it with their original preparation the first time. I also ordered Japanese Curry Rice to go to have later for dinner. You order at the register, and they bring your food to your table. 

My Miso Ramen came out pretty quickly, and they said they would bring my curry out shortly. My dish looked and smelled appetizing, so I dug in. The miso broth was good, and all of the ingredients tasted fresh. I LOVED the ramen noodles. They were cooked to the texture that I like, slightly chewy, and were delicious with the other ingredients. The serving was so large that by the time I finished all of the solids in the bowl, I couldn't finish the miso broth. They were not stingy with anything in the dish. I will go back for the Ramen again!

I didn't taste the Japanese Curry until I got home. It was still warm, but had an overly oily texture that I didn't care for. It was ok reheated later, but I wouldn't try it again.

I can't wait to go back and try some of the other broth flavors for the ramen!

After the staff was rude at Chompies and we left, we ended up here and I'm soooo glad we did!! 1st off, the 2 young men behind the counter were wonderful! They helped a ramen rookie order and got my little guy a kid friendly portion and were just so polite and cool.  The prices were low and the food was delicious.
Great 1st time experience! Got the tempura shrimp soba noodle (added zucchini) w/ a side of kimchi. Delicious. Fast. Clean atmosphere. We'll def be back for more

I've tried multiple different ramen places and this place is just so bad. I can make better ramen from the cup or package that you can buy at Walmart better. Also who puts carrots and spinach in their ramen?? If your Asian and have tried real authentic ramen this is a definite no. I ordered the basic Tonkotsu ramen and it was sub par at best. For meat I got pork and it tasted like it came from a freezer and then was put in a microwave. The only good was I liked the choice on the type of noodle they used. On a side note, the water also tasted like it was unfiltered. Don't waste your time and especially your money. I'm actually disappointed since this place has descent reviews. I'd tell people to try places for themselves but this is a serious pass.

This is my go to place for good cheap ramen. I was introduced to Republic Ramen some years back and when I go I always get the Republic Ramen, original toppings w/spam. 

Only negative is that they never answer the phone if you want to call in an order. Happens more often than not.

If you're looking for a good bang for your buck ramen shop give this one a shot.
Good decor and ambience. Good prices. Huge portions. Very, very mediocre ramen and broth. Tastes almost like instant noodles. Won't be going back. I guess it's ok if you're a starving student.

I've been coming here for years and I always love the food. The service, however, is never great. That's the only reason I can't give this place five stars. Tonight, I saw approached an employee to ask for a spoon. She was on her phone and waited until she finished her text before acknowledging me. I work in a restaurant and personal phones should never be in sight of customers. I saw this employee on her phone four times during my one hour visit tonight. If Republic Ramen could get on their staff about customer service and appropriate behavior, this would be five stars for me.

The food is pretty good but the service is awful. Usually I call and place a to go order, if I am lucky and get through their ridiculous phone system, AND lucky enough to have someone actually answer I am able to place my order. Picking my order up is always a chore....

When you arrive there is usually a line, the amazing part is that you have to wait through this line even for a to go order. After waiting about fifteen minutes you can pick up your order and get out of there. The system that they use to place orders is inefficient and its ridiculous how long it takes. If you're lucky enough to show up around 6PM then you should be prepared to wait a considerable amount of time to order and get your food. 

If you're a fan of Boba, don't plan on their machine working, ever! I've attempted to order it on several occasions and the machine is always down. I don't know if it is the machine or the employees just being lazy but it's pretty awful. 

If you're not a fan of fish then you should avoid the Republic Ramen as it tastes like fish even though there isn't any in it.

In my opinion the best thing on the menu is the Tokyo Ramen with Beef. If you're able to go during off peak times, aren't craving Boba and good dealing with inefficient service then you should be okay.

this place isn't amazing but you get a huge bowl of ramen and it's decent. I got the republic ramen and it was kinda bland and loaded with green onions and spinach. I had to flavor my broth using the chili oil and spices. My boyfriend got the chili pepper ramen and his broth was pretty flavorful already and then adding the spices and chili oil just made it better. their boba was decent and we would probably come back but I would think pho would be my first pick before this.

Ramen is ok. Meat tastes like it's previously frozen. Boba was pretty plain and the balls weren't soft enough. I was told the Republic Ramen is a 7/10 spicy... I would suggest to order an 11 just to get a mildly hot/spicy flavor. My friend got the beef and it looked ok. Will probably just stick to getting pho in the future.

Meh. I've had better. Not very authentic and the broth was mediocre. I asked for the Tonkatsu spicy and they seasoned it way too spicy. Not to mention the charsiu tasted very old. Still on the hunt for a real ramen noodle house in the valley!  Very disappointing.

I'll admit it, I don't know much about the kind of Ramen that doesn't come in a small dehydrated square with a silver seasoning packet, but I really, really liked my food here! 

The price seems a smidge high for what you are ordering, but we did get a crap-load of food for our money!  I ordered the traditional pork ramen and my husband got the spicier version with tofu and we both really liked our food.  Our daughter snacked on a bowl of soybeans and a strawberry icee boba drink and the occasional noodle she swiped from our bowls.  

The place is cute with a slight hipster, college kids vibe, which means my husband and I were wildly out of place with our messy haired toddler and our frazzled thirty-something parent look.  


(Okay, okay...forty-something.  You caught me.)

And being a crotchety old fart, I will also mention the only thing my husband and I didn't care for was the music blaring overhead, but that's okay since I don't suspect we are their primary demographic target, and our 1970's punk music probably won't go over too well with the hipster college set...amiright?  ;-)
You come here for a ramen fix. It's nothing amazing that you'd want to come regularly. Decent food at a decent price.

It was our first time so I asked the blonde at the counter what was good.  She said she didn't know since she doesn't eat the food. Um. Ok.  

I ended up ordering the miso ramen, which a huge mistake.  It was so salty and just had a really weird taste to it.  I couldn't even finish it.

The husband tried the tonkotsu ramen with beef which he enjoyed. Our friend came late and ordered the same thing but the blonde said, "we're out of beef."  So then my friend said, "is the chicken or charsiu better then?"  Her answer, "That's all we have...is chicken or charsiu left."  Um. ok. 

Though my food experience was not the best, my husband enjoyed his, and I'd like to  come back if we're ever on that side of town again to try the tonkotsu or the udon.  I'm willing to give it another try.

But they need a better hostess at the front because she was absolutely clueless.

I really liked this place!  Walking inside to this sleek and beautifully appointed fast/casual restaurant is a stark contrast to the lack-luster strip mall complex that it calls home.  Clean white walls surround the modern chairs and deep benches with dark wood accents.  I love the splash of blue mosaic tiles up front as well.  Whoever designed the interior has a sweet sense of style.

The menu here is really no nonsense.  There's about 4 different types of ramen, an assortment of sides, and then there are multiple variations of Boba in the room adjacent.  I chose the Shoyu Ramen.  The broth was rich and savoury and provided a nice contrast to the simple noodles.  There were a couple large slices of pork in the soup, but I would have preferred more small chunks instead.  I liked that there were lots of bean sprouts in my ramen and it added a satisfying crunch.

I would definitely come here again when I want some Fancy Cup of Noodles without all the preservatives :o)  Don't get confused though, I say Cup of Noodles in loving jest, because really, it's ramen, but this is really good quality stuff.  Give it a try!

Meh... poor location. Service not great. You need to understand the way they several before you get to the counter. Not the traditional ramen house with the customary ordering system. Food was ok at best. I'm ramen sad

Republic Ramen + Noodles 
Looking for a goto Ramen Restaurant in Phoenix, Tempe or Scottsdale. 

This one is not bad but difficult to compare with Los Angeles or San Francisco. 

Good size bowl of Ramen with average amount of condiments added to the bowl.

The Original Broth is good a little on the salty side. To me, one of the most important factors in Ramen is how good the broth soup base is, any restaurant can add as many high end condiments but if the soup base is to hot or not a smooth tasting or appeasing for me, you have automatically lost me.

Ordered the Ramen with original broth with Tonkatsu, like I mentioned the soup base was on the salty side, but not bad, other than that the bowl had had average amount of other items.

Overall I would say it is one of the better Ramen places in town but still searching for that go to Ramen House in town.

In my opinion, this place caters very much to the younger crowd mainly students from nearby ASU, so they will not be as particular as myself

Excellent service and food. Love the ramen. Awesome atmosphere, helps with feeling relaxed. The drinks were on point. I would definitely come here again. I recommend this place to anyone who likes Japanese food.

I love Ramen.  I mean I absolutely love it.  I could eat it everyday of my life if I could.  

This place suits my need for a warm bowl of soup, but as far as it being good Ramen?  Yikes, I would not recommend it over a couple other places with Ramen in the metro Phoenix.  

The dining room is large.  They have many options for your bowl of soup.  BTW, the servings are fairly large.  Give it a try. 

Return Factor: 20%

I wonder if they use ocean water as broth or salt is on sale. I ordered the miso ramen and the broth was so awfully salty that I couldn't finish. I added 2 pack of sugars and a cup of water but didn't help. They do give a large portion and their beef is pretty decent. Their honeydew boba is good too and the reason I give 2 stars.

Republic Ramen:

Cruised through right before close for take out. (I know it's hated but just got out of class)

Disappointed. 

Curry plus chicken was uninspired, rice was cold.  Thin like sad gravy.  No complexity. 

Chili pepper ramen add chicken: cold noodles,  chicken again tasted and looked like un-seasoned. Breast meat so pretty boring.  

On a budget? There are alternatives.  

The service was good.  Staff,  friendly. 
Resteraunt clean.  

The food (aka my reason for getting out of my car fell far short off expectation.  

Never again.

always have really friendly staff, good food, very fast service, huge bowls of ramen/udon, and some good Thai iced tea (boba)

only wish they were closer so we could go more often!
